item.content:encoded:
The best tuition, enrichment, and student care centres in Singapore

Every parent has different reasons for sending their kids to extra classes after school. Perhaps you realise that there’s a particular subject that they’re struggling with; maybe they need a little boost in their studies, or it could just be that they appreciate some personalised guidance with their homework. Whatever your needs may be, it’s not difficult to find a range of options when it comes to tuition classes or after-school student care services that cater to kids of all age groups and school curricula.

But with so many amazing tuition and enrichment centres around, how do you pick the right one? Fret not; we’ve whittled the list down to make the decision a whole lot easier. Here’s our list of top tuition, enrichment, and student care centres in Singapore:

Best tuition centres and enrichment centres in Singapore

1. Nullspace Robotics

  • Enrichment centre specialising in technology education
  • Provider of Computer Enrichment Programmes across all Gifted Education Programme primary schools in Singapore from 2018 to 2025
  • For ages five to 16

If you’re looking to get your child started on technology-based enrichment activities, check out Nullspace Robotics! Established in 2018, this enrichment centre is one of Singapore’s leading technology education providers and comes with a list of impressive credentials. It has been awarded the STEM.org Accredited trustmark, and is a silver winner for Best Technology Education Enrichment Centre in our Singapore Education Awards 2024. More impressively, Nullspace is the appointed vendor by the Ministry of Education (MOE) to run the Computer Enrichment Programme for all nine Gifted Education Programme primary schools in the country from 2018-2025. On top of that, it organises the annual IDE (Innovation, Design, and Engineering) Series, a national level competition in coding, engineering, and robotics. At Nullspace, children learn engineering and programming concepts through hands-on learning experiences, including building and programming their own robots, creating games, or working on individual electronic projects. Besides regular weekly programmes, the centre also has fun holiday workshops for kids. Nullspace currently has training centres in Rochester Mall, Kallang Wave Mall, and SAFRA Tampines.

Bonus: Key in “HONEY50” and snag $50 off your first course sign-up with a minimum purchase of a 10-hour course package (U.P. $480).

 

 

Nullspace Robotic’s website

2. EduFirst Learning Centre

  • Offers tuition, enrichment, and after-school care programmes
  • Small class sizes (maximum of eight students per class)
  • 25 centres across Singapore

You could say that EduFirst Learning Centre is a one-stop hub for all your kids’ education needs. The centre offers everything from subject-based tuition programmes for nursery to secondary school levels, primary school preparation courses for preschoolers, after-school care, and even has a dedicated programme to prep non-Singaporean children who are interested in enrolling into government schools. EduFirst also covers a wide range of primary and secondary school subjects on top of the usual English, Chinese, maths, and science; even including history, geography, social studies, principles of accounting, the three sciences, and add maths. We love that classes are intentionally kept small here, with only four to eight students per class. This means that each kid receives individualised attention, including learning materials that are tailored to their academic needs. These materials are personally prepared by the centre’s tutors, who are all experienced and trained at the National Institute of Education. Plus, they’re just a WhatsApp or phone call away should you have any questions about your kids’ progress. You can also easily find an EduFirst branch near you too, as it has 25 centres around Singapore, including Aljunied, Bukit Timah, Jurong, Pasir Ris, and more.

EduFirst Learning Centre’s contact

3. Academia

  • Top-notch tutors with stellar academic credentials
  • Proven track record
  • For children in Primary 1 and above

These days, it’s all about finding that sweet spot between proven results and our children’s enjoyment. Founded by a Princeton grad and local top student, Academia checks all the boxes by reframing studying in another light as, in their words, learning should never be a chore. Indeed, Academia is all about instilling confidence in students. After all, what is a well-oiled car without a competent driver? Guided by a skilled team of expert instructors, each lesson is specially curated to students’ specific needs. You won’t find a curriculum that’s boring or plain old cookie-cutter here; the instructors go all out of their way to incorporate students’ interests to make the whole experience engaging for the students. The school never stays complacent either, constantly refreshing its curriculum to ensure that lessons are up-to-date. If you or your child need continued support, rest assured that Academia also offers a stellar tutor roster — including graduates from top local universities, Ivy League institutions, and Oxbridge — to give much-needed guidance (and moral support) when applying to universities. Not convinced? Let Academia’s track record speak for itself: it has achieved an almost 100% rate of A/B for O-Level English, and more than 70% Distinction rate for A-Level GP. Each year, more than half of their students score AL1s for their PSLE English. Now, how’s that for a crowning achievement?

Academia’s website

4. The Eton Academy by EtonHouse

  • Offers MOE-aligned English, mathematics, and science tuition programmes
  • Caters to children aged three to 12 years old
  • Five centres around Singapore

You’ve heard of the saying “teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime”. The same applies at The Eton Academy by EtonHouse, where children gain more than just textbook knowledge, but develop independent learning habits as well. This tuition and enrichment centre offers learning programmes in English, maths, and science for Nursery 1 to Primary 6, with the Primary School curriculum closely aligned to MOE’s syllabus. But what makes The Eton Academy stand out is that every lesson is engaging, and children are encouraged to take charge of their learning. This is all possible thanks to the EtonHouse preschools’ signature Inquire-Think-Learn approach, which has been adapted for The Eton Academy. You’ll also love the fact that The Eton Academy provides regular personalised updates on your child’s progress. This is because its educators believe that parents play a crucial role in their children’s learning journey – and we couldn’t agree more!

The Eton Academy by EtonHouse’s website

5. Geniebook CAMPUS

  • Started by Singapore’s leading edtech platform
  • Provides an engaging and tech-enabled learning experience in four locations
  • Caters to local Primary 1-6 levels

Say hello to the tuition centre of the future – Geniebook CAMPUS. This is the latest offering by Geniebook, a leading online learning platform, which has recently expanded to providing on-site tuition at four locations. Its physical tuition centres set themselves apart by providing the same highly personalised learning experience for children as its online platform. Geniebook CAMPUS does this through tech-enabled classrooms, complete with interactive smartboards, tablets, and teacher dashboards that are powered by over 300,000 questions. There are also tools that record your child’s learning activities, which you can view in the form of easy-to-understand infographics in their monthly progress reports. On top of that, your child has access to week-long support from experienced teachers at Geniebook CAMPUS – not just during lessons, but after them too. Another outstanding feature? Every child will receive assignments and feedback that are tailored to their strengths and areas for improvement. All materials are also created by Geniebook CAMPUS’ teachers, and are based on a robust framework that focuses on progressive mastery of learning units in English, Chinese, maths, and science.

Geniebook CAMPUS’ website

6. Kumon

  • Enrichment centre for maths, English, and Chinese
  • For ages three to secondary school level
  • Fixed monthly fee per programme regardless of school level

Most parents will be familiar with Kumon, an enrichment centre known for its unique teaching method that helps children develop self-learning abilities. Fun fact: The famous Kumon method was born from a parent’s love for his child! Its founder, Toru Kumon, prepared his own learning materials and came up with a self-study method to help his son gain proficiency in high school maths. He theorised that this will allow his son more time to pursue his interests and passion. Likewise, Kumon is confident that their method will help children learn, problem-solve, and achieve their full potential by themselves.

Kumon’s website

7. WRITERS AT WORK

  • Enrichment centre specialising in pure composition writing and comprehensive English programmes
  • Caters to children from pre-primary to secondary school level (O-Level)
  • Eight centres islandwide

Here’s an English language enrichment centre with an impressive track record. Two out of three of WRITERS AT WORK’s PSLE students achieve AL1 and AL2 scores in the national exam, while 90% of its secondary school level students saw their results improved by three grades after joining its programmes. This is all thanks to the centre’s effective curriculum, especially its STORYBANKING method that teaches students to build their own library of story ideas, along with picking up important writing elements such as language mechanics, story structure, literary devices, and suspense-building techniques. You could say that it’s like helping kids build their very own English composition toolkit. But it’s not all just for exams – this enrichment centre preps your kids to become confident English language speakers and savvy problem-solvers while developing their linguistic skills. Rest assured that your kiddos are in good hands: all of the teachers here are passionate about helping kids succeed, and have undergone intensive training to deliver lessons in its unique methodology.

WRITERS AT WORK’s website

8. Chengzhu Mandarin Centre

  • Enrichment centre for Chinese
  • Caters for children from six months old to 12 years old
  • Holiday camps available

Chengzhu Mandarin Centre offers Chinese enrichment classes at for children as young as six months using a learner-centred approach, where children learn while having fun. Classes are grouped into three categories: early learning to teach the foundations of the Chinese language; foundational years, which focus on introducing the Chinese culture to students; and school years, which support students to achieve the standards set by MOE for primary school Chinese language curriculum.

Chengzhu Mandarin Centre’s website

9. Busy Bees Learning Centre

  • Tuition centre specialising in Chinese
  • K1 to O Level programmes available
  • Founded by experienced ex-teachers from a top local secondary school

If you’re looking for enrichment centres that specialise in Chinese Language programmes, Busy Bees Learning Centre should definitely be on your list. The centre offers an effective curriculum that’s developed by its three founders, all of whom are experienced teachers from a top secondary school in Singapore. As such, parents can be assured that the programme materials and teachers are very well-versed with the Chinese language syllabus as set by MOE. Busy Bees Learning Centre has two outlets currently: HillV2 and Balmoral Plaza.

Busy Bees Learning Centre’s website

10. Berries World of Learning School

  • Chinese language enrichment centre
  • Caters for N1 to Primary 6 levels
  • 20 centres islandwide

Berries World of Learning School is designed around the concept of a garden. Students are regarded as seedlings who are being cared for and guided by teacher-gardeners. They reap the fruits of knowledge in the harvest stations, aka classrooms. Each Berries World centre has a library and storytelling rooms, where students learn Chinese in fun and experiential ways. Though classes may sound like all fun and games, rest assured that the Chinese curriculum taught at Berries World is tailored according to MOE’s requirements.

Berries World of Learning School’s website

11. Aspire Hub

  • Tuition and enrichment centre
  • Primary 1 to A-Level programmes available
  • 14 centres islandwide

The tutors at Aspire Hub don’t just teach; they coach and motivate their students as well. This centre offers tuition for a wide range of subjects at almost all levels of the Singapore education system. Upon registration, students will sit for a diagnostic and learning style test so that their respective tutors can create a customised learning programme for them. Each student’s portfolio is also managed by an experienced tutor in a personalised manner. As of this year, Aspire Hub has over 90 tutors, all of whom are full-time staff who have been through rigorous training. Individual coaching sessions are also offered on a quarterly basis to help students ace their bi-annual exams.

Aspire Hub’s website

12. Boutique Education

  • Tuition and education support provider
  • Caters to students from local and international schools
  • One-to-one and homeschooling programmes available

Whether your child is attending a local or an international school, Boutique Education is able to provide personalised tuition programmes for them. It’s also the preferred education services provider among families of children from international schools in Singapore. Boutique Education uses a unique approach that maximises a student’s potential and instils a love of learning in them, with programmes for children as young as preschoolers to adults. The tuition company provides a personalised school programme for children who are ‘between’ schools and new to Singapore, as well as an education service for families who are moving to the UK. It also provides special needs services for children with autism and learning difficulties like dyslexia, dyscalculia, ADHD, and ADD.

Boutique Education’s website

13. Coding Lab

  • Coding courses for kids
  • Massachusetts Institute of Technology-inspired curriculum
  • Caters to children aged five to 18

Founded by a Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) alumnus, Coding Lab is one of the top choices among parents who are looking for coding courses for their kids. The centre uses an award-winning MIT-inspired curriculum for its lessons, which are taught by qualified and passionate educators. These lessons are also anything but boring, with interactive boards, games, and tech toys to keep children engaged. Coding Lab currently has two learning centres: located in KAP Mall and Parkway Parade.

Coding Lab’s website

14. Mavis Tutorial Centre

  • Tuition centre
  • Primary, secondary, and junior college levels available
  • 17 centres islandwide

Established in 1986, Mavis Tutorial Centre is pretty much a household name among locals. The centre specialises in English, maths, Chinese, and the sciences for all education levels, also offering advanced science and maths subjects for students in secondary school. Mavis offers The Write Stuff programme too, one that focuses solely on writing and compositions. Most of Mavis’ tutors are ex-school teachers who are highly experienced in the subjects that they teach. The tutors also conduct extra lessons prior to major examinations to guide and motivate students for a final push before their exam days.

Mavis Tutorial Centre’s website

15. MindChamps

  • Enrichment and after-school student care centre
  • For ages three to 12
  • Over 20 centres islandwide

MindChamps has an Enrichment Academy and an after-school care programme, MindSpace. It offers a host of enrichment programmes that teach children skills like writing and reading, learning techniques, public speaking, as well as subject-specific classes. Some of these classes are also offered in MindSpace for primary school students, which start from after school lessons end, all the way till 7pm.

MindChamps Enrichment’s website

16. Tien Hsia Language School

  • Chinese language enrichment school
  • N1 to O Level programmes available
  • Over 10 centres islandwide

According to a survey conducted by Forbes Research Pte Ltd, Tien Hsia Language School is the number one choice for parents in Singapore when it comes to Chinese Language enrichment centres. Positioning itself as a Chinese specialist centre, it has dedicated teachers for each school level. Lessons at Tien Hsia are anything but boring, as it incorporates lively activities that stimulate a student’s sight, hearing, and touch. Not only do these help give lessons a lasting impression on students, but it also encourages them to put what they learn into practice.

Tien Hsia Language School’s website

17. Julia Gabriel

  • Dedicated early learning programmes
  • Debating, readers and writers programmes, and adult learning programmes
  • Holiday camps available

Julia Gabriel has a whole lot of history as the first speech and drama centre to be registered with MOE back in 1991. Fast forward to today, and it’s still regarded as one of the enrichment centres in Singapore. The centre seeks to empower students to communicate confidently through EduDrama, a unique philosophy that involves learning within a positive and enjoyable environment inspired by educators who are passionate about children, language and the arts.

Julia Gabriel’s website

18. Euphoria Education

  • Enrichment centre
  • Specialises in English programmes
  • Preschool and adult programmes available

English lessons are always fun at Euphoria Education. This enrichment centre offers engaging and wholesome English programmes, teaching kids how to master the language with ease and confidence. In addition to using traditional classroom teaching methods, Euphoria teaches kids how to read, write, and speak English through activities like vlogging and podcast-making. Not only do these methods make lessons more memorable, they also help children develop 21st century skills like creative and critical thinking. Aside from English programmes, the centre also organises thematic holiday camps.

Euphoria Education’s website

2. AGrader Learning Centre

  • Tuition and enrichment centre catering to local pre-primary, primary and secondary students
  • Complimentary after-class support system provided
  • 19 locations islandwide

A learning centre that also provides complimentary after-class support? That’s exactly what AGrader Learning Centre is! This tuition and enrichment centre chain has been around since 2013, specialising in English, maths, science, Chinese, and Creative Writing that are aligned with the local primary and secondary school syllabuses. Class sizes in AGrader are intentionally kept small (only 12 students per class) to ensure each student gets sufficient attention and help with their learning. On top of that, every AGrader student receives complimentary after-class support in the form of its proprietary EverLoop Improvement System – a bank of learning resources that students can access at home for revision purposes on top of their weekly lessons. There are past year papers, recorded lessons, revision packs, and all sorts of educational materials that are created by AGrader’s curriculum writers. With all these, it’s no wonder the centre has a proven track record of seeing over 83.4% improvement rate in more than 30,000 students without pre-selecting them!

AGrader Learning Centre’s website

19. Spark Education

  • Online education provider of supplementary learning programmes
  • Specialises in maths
  • For ages six to 12

Spark Education is an online learning platform that brings classes alive by combining highly interactive courseware with specialised teaching methods. Spark Education’s flagship programme, Spark Math, uses a robust research-based curriculum taught by experienced ex-MOE teachers. Each Spark Education class has a low teacher-to-student ratio to offer a more personalised learning experience for children. On top of that, Spark Education uses gamified and animated elements to stimulate learning, making the toughest concepts easier (and fun) to grasp. What’s more, this platform allows your child to learn on the go. All you need is a laptop or tablet, and you’re good to go!

Spark Education’s website

2. The Learning Lab

  • Tuition and enrichment centre
  • N2 to A-level and coding programmes available
  • Has a dedicated Gifted Education Programme (GEP) course

Being one of the top providers of academic enrichment and tutorial services in Singapore, The Learning Lab has a programme for students of all age groups: from as young as N2 in kindergarten, all the way to when they sit for their A-Levels. The centre uses its own learning materials for lessons, which cover interesting topics and address the latest exam format trends. Most importantly, these materials are in line with the Singaporean school syllabus as they’re researched and written by the centre’s specialists. The Learning Lab even has a GEP Excellence programme to expose children to the questions asked in the competitive selection exercise. Plus, it has also started offering coding lessons in partnership with Coding Lab.

The Learning Lab’s profile

21. English Ninjas Enrichment and Tuition Centre

  • English Language specialist enrichment and tuition centre
  • Uses learner-centred in-house curriculum that incorporates current affairs and global issues
  • Empowers learners aged six to 18 with critical thinking skills

Looking for English tuition that would excite your child? Every lesson at English Ninjas opens up a world of learning opportunities for students! Specialising in English, this enrichment and tuition centre leverages the Growth Mindset to nurture critical thinkers and passionate learners. To give students a sense of events and issues beyond the classroom, lessons are conducted with English Ninjas’ in-house curriculum, which incorporates elements of current affairs, global issues, and notable children’s literature. The enrichment and tuition centre focuses on effort and progress in learning, and believes in celebrating every student’s milestones. Keeping lessons flexible to accommodate different needs, students have the option to attend classes in person or remotely on Zoom. In-person classes are conducted in a cosy space, with each classroom named after a location from a fiction book or movie: The Shire, Narnia, Endor, and Stormhold. In addition, English Ninjas boasts a curated library, full of exciting titles that will pique every student’s interest.

English Ninjas’ website

item.content:encoded:
Life beyond school: How these international schools are preparing students for the real world

There’s one thing that all schools have in common: they all share a mission in developing students who are educated, independent, and able to contribute to society. In essence, every aspect of the schooling experience goes towards preparing students to take the big step into the real world after graduation.

However, the ‘real world’ as we know it is changing rapidly at an unprecedented pace. This also means that our children will be facing never-before-seen challenges when it’s time to leave school. As such, it’s more important than ever for schools to ensure their students are equipped with real-world skills and be future-ready.

We spoke to some of Singapore’s top international schools to find out how they prepare students to take on the real world.

Nexus International School (Singapore)

Year 9 to 13 learners at Nexus International School (Singapore) get prepped for the world beyond school walls through the Careers and University Programme. This programme is delivered through the joint efforts of Nexus’ Careers and University Counsellors, International Baccalaureate Coordinators, Phase Leaders, and even the learners’ teachers themselves.

The programme starts in Year 9, where the main focus is for learners to find out more about their skills and interests, as well as get to know themselves as an individual. In Year 10, learners are encouraged to discuss their aspirations for the future as they sit for a series of psychometric tests and quizzes. Not only do these help with subject recommendations as they move on to higher grade levels, they also serve as a foundation for the NEXSteps Career Programme. As they progress to Years 10 to 12, learners get to participate in the exciting NexSteps workshops where they learn about entrepreneurship and career exploration. Last but not least, Year 12 learners get one-on-one sessions with their guidance counsellor all the way through their final year.

Learners are always thrilled to join the NexSteps workshops, which includes activities like the Young Founders School bootcamp led by seasoned entrepreneurs and industry leaders; as well as panel talks featuring representatives from Apple, Google, Airbnb, and more. On top of these, learners get to benefit from the annual NexSteps Future Readiness Career Fair not just to learn about career options, but also get interview tips from employees of companies like Apple and CIMB. Another highlight of the workshops is the mock job interview sessions organised by Nexus, which allow learners to gain valuable insights about their curriculum vitae (CV) and interview responses. Tailored university sessions are prepared for Year 12 learners to find out more about university and course requirements, as well as workshops on college essay-writing, practice interviews, and even one on writing a strong CV.

Nexus International School’s (Singapore) profile

Tanglin Trust School

Curious as to how the gold winner for International School with the Most Future-Ready Students preps its students for the real world? Tanglin Trust School’s students and families have The Institute @ Tanglin to thank for.

The Institute is set up to inspire, challenge, and prepare the school’s students to step up into their role as future leaders. This is done through inviting thought leaders across disciplines for speaker events and various programmes with industry partners. The Institute recently concluded its successful Centenary ‘Future Of’ speaker series, which featured experts in forward thinking areas of AI, robotics, future of medical health, and geopolitics. Its programmes also bring in industry experts to coach and work directly with students.

Here’s a peek: The Institute held a 16-week Entrepreneurship Programme in partnership with Reactor School, which saw four Sixth Form student teams pitch their business ideas to a judging panel consisting of business leaders and venture builders. Tanglin’s students examined real-world problems based on United Nations’ Sustainable Development Goals and came up with solutions, which they then turned into fully developed prototypes and pitched for ‘pre-seed’ funding – just like in the real world! EduBot, the team that won the best pitch prize had a scalable, feasible business idea (with an interested investor secured) to improve educational outcomes in rural Indonesia. Initiatives like this creates opportunities to broaden interdisciplinary thinking, encourage creativity, innovation, and challenge students, ensuring they have what it takes to flourish within school and beyond.

Tanglin Trust School’s profile

The GUILD International College

For neurodivergent young adults, navigating the real world comes with its own unique set of challenges. Aside from the dynamic nature of the job market, neurodivergent youths also face hurdles in the form of communication barriers, sensory sensitivity, executive function struggles, as well as possible limited understanding of neurodiversity on the employer’s part.

As an inclusive school that also caters to youths with special needs, The GUILD International College is on a mission to bridge this gap in the labour market and help its students succeed. Pre-vocational and vocational training, as well as job readiness skill development are crucial elements in the college’s Transition Programme and Career Pathways Programmes. Students as young as 16 can participate in these programmes, where they pick up digital office skills, teaching assistant training, culinary skills in baking, hotel operations training, and floristry, just to name a few. The GUILD International College has a specialised in-house Job Coach too, who offers ongoing guidance and support to students throughout their transition journey.

Efforts to help students transition don’t just take place within college walls. The GUILD International College actually provides training to potential employers about the different disabilities, even supporting them on making the workplace inclusive for neurodivergent youths. There are also partnerships between the college and organisations to create internship opportunities for its students. Last but not least, educators, therapists, and counsellors of the college work closely with students and their families to create a transition that’s holistic and seamless for them.

The GUILD International College’s profile

ISS International School

Aside from the IB, students at ISS International School have the option to pursue the American-style High School Diploma (HSD) programme from Grade 9. This is a student-centred programme that prioritises competency-based learning, with a curriculum that focuses on real-world skill mastery that prepares students for admission to top universities around the world. It also stands out as a collaborative effort among students, parents, and educators, who all come together to create a supportive and empowering educational environment for the students.

In the HSD, students take on both academic and specialised courses that allow them to explore and deep-dive into their respective interests. A portfolio component – which may cover anything from awareness campaigns to entrepreneurship projects – is included to provide students with a beyond-classroom learning experience. They’re also required to complete a final year project that solves real-world problems under the guidance of a mentor (usually an industry professional that’s related to their projects and areas of interest). Last but not least, ISS regularly collaborates with experts and international organisations to facilitate guest speaker sessions for its students.

ISS’ Head of HSD Mr. Kelly Millar describes the programme as one that looks beyond exam scores. “The HSD programme is not just about achieving high test scores, but measures success by the impactful qualities students bring to their lives and communities. This is an immersive learning experience that cultivates practical skills, ensuring students navigate real-world challenges with assurance and resilience.” The programme has made an excellent impact on its students, including Sebastian from Grade 12: “I feel assured and well-prepared. This is not just a programme; it is my guiding compass, equipping me to navigate and conquer the challenges of the real world ahead.”

ISS International School’s profile

International French School (Singapore)

The French education system places significant importance on equipping students with an extensive set of “real world skills”. These skills include language proficiency and communication, critical thinking, math and science competence, cultural literacy, digital literacy, research and information literacy, global awareness, as well as citizenship and ethics. Students are equipped with these at International French School (Singapore), as the school follows a comprehensive educational approach that goes beyond traditional academics. Through emphasis on these skills, IFS ensures that its students grow into academically proficient, well-rounded individuals who are able to excel in diverse contexts and make meaningful contributions to the world.

In line with the French education system, IFS encourages students to participate in extracurricular activities (ECAs) that align with their interests; while promoting skills like leadership, teamwork, and creativity. For instance, student-led independent research projects fosters curiosity and willingness to tackle challenges. Strong communication skills, acquired through activities such as public speaking and debates, are crucial for post-high school success. Digital literacy and technology are integrated into IFS’ curriculum to prepare students for the modern digital landscape. It also has a University Guidance Program that assists students in identifying their career goals, selecting suitable universities and programmes, as well as preparing application materials. On top of that, internship opportunities are offered to provide students with real-world experience and skills development. But that’s not all – mental health and wellbeing of students are prioritised at IFS too. Its Secondary School counselling programme focuses on student wellbeing and offering support in all aspects of their school life. Counsellors address students’ unique needs, promote a healthy lifestyle and a sense of purpose beyond education, ultimately preparing them for life.

International French School’s (Singapore) profile

Sir Manasseh Meyer International School

For Sir Manasseh Meyer International School (SMMIS), preparing students for the real world means giving them future ready skills as well as a safe and secure start in life. The school believes it’s essential to help young people develop emotional and social resilience, teach them language and positive communication skills, as well as technology and STEAM to make them future-ready. The ability to communicate clearly and respectfully is a key skill; whereas knowledge in technology and STEAM teaches students to navigate the increasingly digitalised world safely and ethically. But most importantly, social and emotional resilience ensures students can take care of their own wellbeing and mental health.

SMMIS incorporates all these in its academic curriculum and co-curricular offerings. Students are taught future-ready skills and resilience through Personal, Social and Health Education lessons, Drama and Public Speaking classes, Makerspace and IT classes, and more. The wide array of After-School Activities provided, as well as local and overseas field trips also prepare students for a life beyond school. Teaching staff are trained to use Artificial Intelligence in the classroom ethically to equip students with technology skill sets. In line with its commitment to Tikkun Olam (repairing the world), SMMIS places strong emphasis on community service through Service Learning and its National Youth Achievement Award. Students gain lifelong skills and empathy by volunteering in the Student Council and running House activities.

Sir Manasseh Meyer International School’s profile

Overseas Family School

The curriculum and programmes at Overseas Family School (OFS) are intentionally designed to strengthen 21st century competencies among its students. This includes teaching students critical and inventive thinking, as well as values like empathy and resilience. All these are integrated into the curriculum from kindergarten onwards.

Academic-wise, the IB curriculum at OFS is delivered with a strong focus on transferable skills like research, communication, critical thinking, collaboration, and reflection. For example: OFS is one of the few schools that provide students with the opportunity to conduct their Extended Essay in World Studies. This encourages students to investigate challenging global issues that cannot be adequately investigated within the confines of a single subject. Unique programmes such as chess and coding are included as a compulsory part of OFS’ Elementary School curriculum. These programmes teach students to think strategically and boost their problem-solving skills. Aside from these, OFS’ Model United Nations and extensive Mother Tongue Programs nurtures an appreciation for multiculturalism and multilingualism – as essential aspect in our interconnected world.

Students at OFS also have the opportunity to engage in a wide array of extracurricular activities. This facilitates the Creativity, Activity, Service (CAS) component of the IB, as students can participate in activities like the Red Cross, The Ocean Project, and Riding for the Disabled. Students can also join special interest clubs like Law Academy, Medical Scholars, and the Psychology Club. These give students the chance to lead, collaborate, make a meaningful impact on their community, and explore future careers.

Overseas Family School’s profile

item.content:encoded:
Which holiday workshop is perfect for your child’s personality?

We don’t know about you, but our kids really enjoy holiday workshops. They have so much fun, make lots of new friends and, hey, it sure beats staying at home! If you don’t know where to start, be spoiled for choice with UOL Malls’ first ever U-CAMP Holiday Workshops that’s happening over this upcoming school holiday, with workshops for every personality and age group. More conveniently, the holiday workshops are held across all three of its malls: United Square, Velocity@Novena Square, and KINEX. So you get to choose one that’s nearer to you.

Read on to figure out which holiday workshop you think will suit your kid best…

1. For the movers and shakers

Does your child start tapping their toes whenever the radio comes on, or can’t resist grooving to the beat when their favourite song plays? This school holiday, give them the opportunity to create their own music which, of course, starts with learning a new instrument!

U-CAMP Holiday Workshops classes to check out:

  • Velocity@Novena Square: Believer Music’s guitar or drums introductory classes held on 17 and 18 June are suitable for everyone aged 10 and above.
  • KINEX: For kiddos from age seven onwards, feel the beat with Fine Momentum Academy’s (1-to-1 session) introduction to Drum Groove, Basic Drum Fill-in, Rock & Pop Music classes.
    Want to complement their new-found musical skills with some sleek moves? Dance classes are available too, including an introduction to Kpop, hiphop, or tumbling by Distinct Creative Arts. Choose from June and the start of July, for children aged three  and above.

2. For the energiser bunnies

If your child has lots of energy to burn, why not channel all that vigour into some martial arts classes and workshops? Besides, it’s never too early to start picking up self defence skills.

U-Kids Holiday Camp classes to check out:

  • KINEX: Let your little fighters learn Brazilian Jiu-jitsu from the renowned Evolve MMA on 21 June. Children between the ages of five to twelve are more than welcome!
  • United Square: Give your kids from age five to 12 a detailed introduction to Brazilian Jiu-Jitsu by The Gentle Art on 23 and 24 June.
  • Velocity@Novena Square: The basic Muay Thai and self-defence workshop by Fight Zone on 14, 15, 28, and 29 June looks to be a real highlight for children between the ages of seven and 19.

We can go on and on about the benefits of outdoor sports. With fresh air, a healthy dose of exercise, and great team-building skills, what’s not to like? We don’t know about you, but we’ll never pass up on the opportunity to let our little ones hone their skills or pick up a new sport.

  • KINEX: Let your kiddos shoot some hoops at KOTC Basketball’s basketball clinics held on 21 and 22 June.
  • United Square: Seize the chance to let the little ones, aged seven all the way to 18, find their asanas, guided by Reality Yoga on 19 and 20 June. Or, train them with basketball techniques across various skills levels and ages at the KOTC basketball clinics on 12 and 13 June.
  • Velocity@Novena Square: Is pickleball more their style? Pitch in on the recent craze with a pickleball workshop for beginners on various dates in June. This workshop is catered for players aged seven to 12. Adults and older kids can also participate in the adults classes for players above 12 years old.

3. For the dreamers

Here’s a heads-up for all the aspiring artists and creative souls in our troop! There are workshops and classes dedicated to letting their creative juices flow.

U-CAMP Holiday Workshops to check out:

  • KINEX: Does your mini-me enjoy hands-on activities? Kids seven years and up will have fun painting their own sneakers in a class by MurcyArt Gallery from 30 May to 6 July. Otherwise, level up by encouraging your children five years and up to paint an A4 canvas together with Tree Art on various dates in June and July.
    Or, perhaps your little foodie has always dreamed of whipping up a feast in the kitchen? They can do so during Little Cook’s short and sweet cooking class from 30 May to 6 July, where they’ll learn how to cook delicious dishes designed specially for children. We love that this workshop is suitable for young ones aged two and above too!
  • United Square: If your kiddos from nine to 10 years old have shown an interest in the written word, give them a taste of journalism with Aspire Hub Education on 11 June, where they can step into the shoes of a young journalist for two hours.
    On the other hand, Hua Language Centre’s approach of combining language lessons with craft activities on 16 and 18 June could be a great way to make learning more interactive and enjoyable, especially for younger learners.

4. For the thinkers

We’ve all been there: sometimes our children have an ‘a-ha!’ moment, or they surprise us with their analytical thinking. If your child can always find their way out of a pickle in a jiffy, they might be a strategist in the making – sign them up for a chess or coding session to challenge their thinking skills!

U-CAMP Holiday Workshops to check out:

  • United Square: Inspired by Queen’s Gambit, we’ve tried (and failed) to navigate our way through chess. Perhaps, your little ones will fare better? Give them — children aged six to 12 — a good headstart and foundation with Chess At Three’s beginner and advanced classes on 24 and 25 June.

For beginners, coders between the ages of five and 11 can learn the ropes from Futurum Academy during an introduction to coding and robotics from 17 to 19 June.

  • KINEX: For the mini tech whizzes between the ages of seven and 12, they’ll absolutely love The Lab’s introduction to game design (specifically the Super Mario Platformer game) on 11, 12, and 13 June.

Bonus: Parent-child workshops

Want to make some great memories this school holiday? Sign up for a workshop that you can enjoy together with your child! Asterspring is hosting a fun skincare fundamentals class at United Square from 26 to 27 June. Kids can get started on caring for their skins, and parents will pick up some invaluable tips to incorporate into your daily routine. Each workshop is suitable for one parent and one child (from 11 years old), and will include a sweet $40 store credits for you to spend after.

Found something that suits your kid? Here’s how to sign up.

All you need to do is be part of UOL Malls’ reward system, U-POPP, to access these fun workshops and classes with your kids. First, you’ll need to have a minimum spend of $60 to redeem up to two workshops of your choice. With these workshop passes, you’ll be able to attend any workshop for just $10/$20 each!

Bonus: U-POPP members can also redeem a limited-edition tumbler with a minimum of $120 spent, or a $10 UOL e-voucher (valid at the respective mall) with a minimum $180 spend.

This post is in partnership with UOL Malls.

Download Living in Singapore: our 2025 FREE e-book for families

Whether you’ve recently made the big move to Singapore or have lived here for years, one thing is for sure – things change fast, and there’s always something new going on! With fun family events happening every weekend and new things coming to our shores every month, how do you make sure you don’t get FOMO? Well, luckily, the answer is easy: right here!

Expat e-book 2025: Your complete guide to living in Singapore

There’s always so much going on in the little red dot, so we’ve decided to put together this handy guide to help you live the sweet life in Singapore. We’re covering everything – from all the essentials as well as the fun stuff, like the best playgrounds, dining options and the latest attractions to keep the kids entertained.

And let’s be honest – keeping the kids entertained is priority number one when school holidays hit and you still have a million and one things on your plate. To save you the hassle of researching options, we’ve included the perfect go-to cheat sheet for guaranteed family fun in Singapore. We also know the temperature here can be a shock to the system, even after living here for years, so we’ve made sure all the ideas are perfect for keeping cool and beating the heat.

So what are you waiting for? Grab a coffee, sit back, and take a peek at this guide to see why living in Singapore really is the best!

Download our free 2025 e-book

item.content:encoded:
WIN prizes for Dad in our Father’s Day Giveaway!

It’s papa’s special day just around the corner (Father’s Day is on 16 June!), so we’ve decided to pull out all the stops for the favourite men in our lives with our Father’s Day giveaway! If you want to spoil Dad (or if you’re a father yourself and think you deserve a treat), then enter by 12 June 2025 to be in with a chance of winning!

HoneyKids Asia Father’s Day Giveaway 2025

"*" indicates required fields

Name*
Which prize(s) would you like to win?*
Consent*
Note: You may be contacted by third party sponsor(s) and may unsubscribe at any time.

What you need to know about our giveaway: The competition closes at midday on 12 June 2025, and winners will be notified following this date via email. Winners need to be in Singapore to claim their prizes. All T&Cs will be at the discretion of vendors. This giveaway is non-refundable or exchangeable for cash. Check out our full competition terms and conditions for more details.

1. Win Dad a pair of new kicks from Skechers

Stand out with a fresh kick from Skechers Street Shadow – Stellar 90. This sporty fashion lace-up features a metallic duraleather and mesh upper with a cushioned Skechers Air-Cooled Memory Foam® insole to deliver long-lasting comfort with enhanced breathability, ensuring your feet stay stylishly cool while in Singapore’s humid weather.

Additional Features:
– Synthetic metallic duraleather and mesh upper
– Skechers Air-Cooled Memory Foam® cushioned comfort insole
– Sporty lace-up fashion sneaker
– Flexible traction outsole
– 1 1/2-inch heel height
– Skechers® logo detail

Prize Details:

Skechers Singapore is offering 2 x pairs of Skechers footwear to 2 x winners (one pair each). Winners will be able to select a footwear of their choice from any Skechers collection including from the Skechers Street Shadow collection, subject to size and availability.

2. Treat the family to lunch or dinner at Altro Zafferano

If an Italian restaurant with a stunning view is what you’re looking for to wow Dad this Father’s Day, then this is the prize for you! Executive Chef Andrea De Paola and Head Chef Federico Schiraldi have crafted some absolutely delicious menus for you to enjoy with Dad on his special day.

The new a la carte menu is crafted for flexibility and shared enjoyment, perfect for a family meal. Showcasing Southern Italy’s robust, flavours drawn from the freshest premium ingredients, we’ve got our eye on the Carpaccio di Manzo, Pecorino e Senape ($26++). Delicate slices of prime Australian grain-fed beef are brushed with balsamic vinegar, rolled with rocket and pecorino cheese. There’s a lovely selection of pastas, and leave space for dessert – they have a classic crowd-favourite, Tiramisu!

Prize Details:

Altro Zafferano are offering 1 x winner a prize total of $300 divided into 3 x $100 cash vouchers – use them separately, or all at once! Terms & Conditions: Valid for dine-in only. Vouchers are valid up till the stated date; there is strictly no extension of voucher validity. Vouchers are not replaceable, exchangeable, or refundable, in part or in whole. No refunds will be provided for any unused amount of the voucher.

3. Win a dining voucher from KANTIN

Drawing inspiration and ingredients from one of the oldest rainforests in the world and rooted in the bold traditions of Borneo’s headhunter ancestors, KANTIN at Jewel Changi presents a one-of-a-kind experience with authentic jungle food. Standouts from the menu include the tribal Headhunter Pansuh Set, with purple rice, Borneo bamboo chicken and Dayak sides of the day.

We can’t wait to try the Superdry Laksa, a dry wok hei variation of the Sarawak speciality, the aromatic and grilled Sotong Bakar, and Rainforest Fried Rice, made with indigenous wild herbs such as torch ginger flowers, and tapioca leaves. The restaurant also has a selection of seven Singapore-exclusive cocktails, including the tropical Borneo Sling, a surprising twist on the classic Singapore Sling!

Prize Details:

KANTIN is offering 1 x S$250 dining voucher (which serves 5 pax) for 1 x winner!

4. Counselling session with Marissa Nasution

Therapy provides a safe, non-judgmental space to explore thoughts and emotions, sometimes for the very first time. Even a single session can be meaningful, offering the chance to express what has been held in silence and make sense of what feels heavy or unclear. It allows people to reflect, feel heard, and begin to understand themselves in new ways. Whether someone is navigating stress, emotional pain, relationship challenges, or seeking clarity, therapy creates room for honest conversation and understanding one’s inner world.

This Father’s Day, Marissa Nasution is offering a free therapy session for dads: because dads need it too. Whether it is the mental load, parenting stress, emotional overwhelm, work stress, or just needing to get things off your chest, this can be the first step in sharing and understanding what you might be going through.

Prize Details:

Marissa Nasution is offering 1 x Counselling Session for 1 x winner, worth S$270

5. Give Dad the gift of a wellness bundle from LAC

This Father’s Day, LAC (pronounced L-A-C), Leader in Antioxidative Control, Asia’s largest specialty retailer in nutritional supplements, celebrates the dad who gives his all. Behind every long day and every moment of support is a father striving to be his best — for himself and his family. As conversations around men’s health and self-care gain traction, there’s a shift toward more thoughtful ways to show appreciation. Supporting dad with simple, effective wellness tools — whether it’s for energy, focus, or recovery — is one way to help him feel his best, not just for the occasion, but for the long run.

Prize details:

Papa’s Power Pack specially curated for 1 x winner consisting of the following products:

LAC Men’s Mega Multi Active – For the busy dad who does it all, this multivitamin delivers over 40 clinically researched vitamins, minerals, and nutrients in one powerful formula. It’s designed to support overall health, boost physical performance, aid muscle function, and fortify immunity—helping him stay energised, strong, and fully present for every moment that matters.

LAC Men’s Mega Maca – A fast-acting liquid blend tonic with key ingredients such as L-Arginine and Maca Root that lets you regain your “mojo” through improved endurance and stamina.

LAC BrainSpeed® PS – A high potency Phosphatidylserine brain formula with added Choline to sharpen the mind, improve alertness and memory, and optimise brain performance – helping dad stay sharp and balanced as he navigates work, family, and personal goals with ease.

6. Treat dad to a special meal at Marmalade Pantry with a $200 dining voucher

Gather the family and indulge Dad with a well-deserved meal at The Marmalade Pantry. From well-loved classics like the Spicy Crabmeat Pasta and Crispy Skin Salmon to signature sweets like the Sticky Date Pudding and Pandan Gula Melaka Cake, it is the perfect setting to honour Dad with good food and great company.

Prize Details:

1 x S$200 dining voucher for 1 x winner! Terms & Conditions: Valid for dine-in only. Vouchers are valid up till the stated date; there is strictly no extension of voucher validity. Vouchers are not replaceable, exchangeable, or refundable, in part or in whole. No refunds will be provided for any unused amount of the voucher. Other T&Cs Apply.

7. Fun with the family at PastaMania

If papa goes gaga for pasta, then PastaMania is the place to go for a Father’s Day meal! Choose from Italian classics like prawn aglio or carbonara, or go fancy with fusion delights like seafood tom yum or pizza!

Prize Details:

PastaMania is offering 2 x S$100 dining vouchers for 2 x winners! Terms & Conditions: Valid for dine-in only. Vouchers are valid up till the stated date; there is strictly no extension of voucher validity. Vouchers are not replaceable, exchangeable, or refundable, in part or in whole. No refunds will be provided for any unused amount of the voucher.

8. Treat dad to a sourdough frenzy at Baker & Cook

This Father’s Day, celebrate Dad with hearty brunch at Baker & Cook where sourdough takes centre stage in every dish — flavourful, gut-friendly, and made with a 37-year-old sourdough starter, “Little Johnny”. From the B&C Signature Sourdough Bread Board and Mushroom Pâté on Toast to French Toast and more, whether you’re craving sweet or savoury, there’s something to satisfy every palate in the family!

Prize Details:

Baker & Cook is offering 1 x S$200 dining voucher for 1 x winner! Terms & Conditions: Valid for dine-in only. Vouchers are valid up till the stated date; there is strictly no extension of voucher validity. Vouchers are not replaceable, exchangeable, or refundable, in part or in whole. No refunds will be provided for any unused amount of the voucher.

9. A Cinematic Odyssey at CapitaLand Malls – Official Movie Merchandise Bundle

From now until 6 July 2025, CapitaLand is rolling out its first-ever triple blockbuster campaign across Singapore—bringing larger-than-life movie-themed experiences to participating malls. Named “A Cinematic Odyssey at CapitaLand Malls”, this immersive campaign brings to life three fan-favourite franchises: Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning, How to Train Your Dragon, and Jurassic World Rebirth.

Across three thrilling months, you can step into the shoes of a secret agent, dragon rider, or daring explorer through high-octane challenges, AI-powered photo ops, cinematic walkthroughs, and interactive scavenger hunts. Plus, if you’re a CapitaStar member, you can stand a chance to attend three special movie preview screenings. Try your hand at themed challenges for your chance to redeem exclusive official movie merchandise!

Prize includes:

For one lucky dad, CapitaLand Malls have a bundle of exclusive move merchandise to giveaway this Father’s Day! The bundle includes (subject to change and availability):

1 x Mission Impossible Bluetooth Speaker
1 x Mission Impossible Crewneck
1 x Mission Impossible Keychain
1 x How To Train Your Dragon Adult Tee
1 x How To Train Your Dragon Beach Tote
1 x How To Train Your Dragon Texture Tumblr
1 x How To Train Your Dragon Polyester Kite

10. Durian delights from Cat & the Fiddle

Crafted by celebrated pâtissier Daniel Tay, Cat & the Fiddle is Singapore’s pioneering online premium cheesecake retailer. Renowned for its artisanal flair and imaginative flavours, the brand features over 20 types of gourmet cheesecakes — from beloved classics like Classic New York and OREO® Cookies & Cream, to inventive local twists such as Milo Dinosaur and MSW Durian.

This Father’s Day, go beyond the usual and treat Dad to Cat & the Fiddle’s limited-edition Durian Éclair Set; a luxurious selection of five éclairs in bold flavour pairings like Mao Shan Wang, Durian Chocolate, and even Durian Avocado. Available from 19 May 2025 in stores and online, this indulgent set is the ultimate way to crown Dad the King of Taste.

Prize Details (worth $158.30):

Cat & the Fiddle are giving away the following prize bundle for 1 x winner, worth $158.30:
1 x Fickle Feline Cheesecake – $58.90
1 x MSW Durian Éclairs – $39.50
1 x CAT Plushie (L) – $59.90

11. Celebrate Dad with Sparkanauts classes

This Father’s Day, we’re celebrating the everyday heroes. Dads who show up, lift up, and grow alongside their little ones through every milestone. As a tribute to your dedication, Sparkanauts are offering a special weekday 6-class package (worth $510 SGD!) Each 75-minute session is thoughtfully designed to nurture connection through movement, play, and bonding, strengthening not just your relationship, but also your child’s developing neural pathways.

Prize Details:

This Father’s Day, Sparkanauts invites 1 x winner to celebrate the joy of fatherhood with a giveaway that builds both hearts and muscles. Win a 6-class package (worth $510) for babies and toddlers aged 6 months to 3 years! Our parent-child classes combine gentle gymnastic activities, music, and movement to support physical milestones and early brain development—while creating beautiful bonding moments. From guided rolls to tackling Trapeze, every class is a chance for dads to be part of their child’s holistic growth journey.

12. Spoil your old man with gifts from Old Seng Choong

Founded by acclaimed pastry chef Daniel Tay, Old Seng Choong celebrates the joy of traditional bakes that honour heritage and heartfelt family moments. Named after the original Seng Choong Confectionery, opened by Tay’s parents in 1965, the brand is a tribute to his late father — a baker of over 30 years — and the traditions that inspired his culinary journey.

Old Seng Choong is beloved for its nostalgic bakes and seasonal festive offerings. This Father’s Day, the brand presents a thoughtfully curated collection of classic treats designed to stir up sweet memories and pay tribute to generations of love.

Prize Details:

Old Seng Choong is giving 1 x winner the following prize bundle (worth $158.80):

Twin Box Gift Set – $45.60
Dark Chocolate Chiffon Cake – $28.80
Kueh Lapis (Prune) – $48.80
Salted Egg Fish Skin – $18.80
Assorted Pastry Gift Set A – $16.80

So what are you waiting for? Get entering, and treat Daddy-O to something lovely this Father’s Day!

item.content:encoded:
UPDATED June 2025: Kids’ theatre shows, concerts and musicals in Singapore

Looking for kids’ theatre shows in Singapore? I am obsessed with taking my kids to see musicals, plays, and performances, so it’s my job to list out the best shows in Singapore for the whole family to enjoy. Not only do big productions, gorgeous costumes, and lively tunes enthral the kids (and offer up insta-worthy pics of the day out!), theatre experiences create cultural awareness, an appreciation for the arts, and most importantly, everlasting memories for the whole fam. Seeing a live musical or concert is also an excellent opportunity to inspire your little aspiring thespian or musician to get into the performing arts. Plus, escaping to the theatre is a perfect thing to do with the kids when the weather’s bogging you down. Here’s a rundown of what to expect this year – check back regularly for real-life reviews when the shows open. Make sure you bookmark this list, as I add new shows when they are released every month!

Kids’ theatre, concerts, events and shows in Singapore 2025

1. NEW: CoComelon: Sing-A-Long LIVE, with special guest Blippi!

Blippi is coming to Singapore with his friends from CoComelon! Toddlers will be besides themselves with excitement as their favourite characters step off the screen and onto the stage for the first time in Singapore at Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands, with a vibrant new musical show, CoComelon: Sing-A-Long LIVE. CoComelon’s favourite teacher, Ms. Appleberry welcomes JJ, his friends, Blippi and your little one to come along on a Melon Patch Musical field trip! Guaranteed heart explosions as your kiddo sings and dances to their favourite bops, including “If You’re Happy and You Know It,” “Wheels on the Bus,” “Animal Dance,”and many more. Best bit: We are looking out for the special guest appearance by Blippi singing “The Excavator Song!”

When: Saturday 28 and Sunday 29 September 2025
Where: CoComelon: Sing-A-Long LIVE with special guest Blippi, Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands. 
Tickets: Early Bird save 12% from 8 – 11 May, prices from $78 – $138.

2. NEW ON SALE: Little Red Riding Hood, presented by ACT 3 International

ACT 3 International is back with its theatre season, this time bringing the tale of Little Red Riding Hood to life with puppets and songs. Presented by the award-winning UK-based children’s theatre company LYNGO, this interactive theatre show puts a twist on the classic Grimm fairy tale, where you and the kids will be joining Red on a journey. Pay attention to her surroundings – you never know what surprises you’ll find in the stage’s secret compartments and hidden hatches. Kids will also get the chance to see beautifully handmade theatre toys in action. But whatever you do, beware of the Big Bad Wolf.

Bonus: Grab your tickets before 27 June 2025 to enjoy 15% off!

When: 26 July – 3 August 2025
Where: Little Red Riding Hood, Drama Centre Black Box in National Library Building

* Little Red Riding Hood is suitable for children aged four and above.

3. COMING SOON: Beauty and the Beast, presented by ACT 3 International

You better hold on to your seats, because this isn’t going to be your typical theatre show. More than just a wildly funny production, DuffleBag Theatre’s retelling of Beauty and the Beast puts audience participation at the heart of every performance. That’s right — your kids could be the next characters on stage! Expect lots of LOL moments, spontaneous fun, and unexpected twists in this version of the beloved fairy tale, which is mainly unscripted and fueled by the cast’s boundless imagination. This means that no two Beauty and the Beast shows are the same. Step into the hidden castle and see what happens when the beautiful Belle meets the “horrible, nasty Beast”. Is Belle the one who can break the spell? You’ll just have to watch to find out.

Bonus: Snag 15% ticket prices when you purchase yours by 27 June 2025.

When: 27 September – 5 October 2025
Where: Beauty and the Beast, Drama Centre Black Box in National Library Building

* Beauty and the Beast is suitable for children aged four and above.

4. NEW: Kidsfest returns with the Tiger Who Came to Tea

The live theatre adaptation of the beloved kids story is coming back to Singapore this September. Tickets go on sale on 8 May, watch this space for more details!

When: 12 – 14 September 2025
Where: The Tiger Who Came to Tea, Victoria Theatre. 

5. The Phantom of the Opera – Tickets on sale now! [Recommended age 10+]

Ooooh, I am so excited for this! One of the most well-loved musicals of all time is returning to Singapore this May. Andrew Lloyd Webber’s remarkable production, The Phantom of the Opera, will be haunting the stage at Sands Theatre for a strictly limited season. This dark love story tells the tale of a mysterious masked figure (played in Singapore by South African theatre star Jonathan Roxmouth) who lurks beneath the Paris Opera House, exercising a reign of terror over all who inhabit it. He falls madly in love with a young soprano, Christine Daae (the lovely Grace Roberts) and devotes himself to nurturing her extraordinary talents. Stars Jonathan and Grace will be joined by a talented global cast of 37 performers from all over the world!

We caught the gala night of The Phantom of the Opera and even with a familiar plot, the show struck a different chord this time. It wasn’t just a captivating performance with beautiful vocals, it was also an expressive and emotionally rich portrayal of the Phantom and Christine. Our favourite parts were the renditions of “Think of Me” and “Music of the Night”, while we felt that “That’s All I Ask of You” was slightly rushed in its delivery. However, the show was still mesmerising, leaving us moved by its music and striking vocals, dramatic staging, and its timeless allure. This time, there are even stunning photo points perfect to snap up the memories of the night. For those sensitive to lights, do note that there are some strobing lights at the beginning of the show.

When: Now till 22 June 2025
Where: The Phantom of the Opera, Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands. Tickets from $88

6. Lang Lang Plays Disney in Concert

There’s no better way to inspire a young musician than to see a master at their craft, performing live. After a decade, legendary pianist Lang Lang makes his long-awaited return to the Singapore stage with ‘Lang Lang Plays Disney in Concert’. Hailed as the “ultimate collaboration,” this performance celebrates the iconic melodies that have brought Disney’s beloved stories to life for generations.

When: Thursday 12 and Saturday 14 June 2025, 7:30pm
Where: Lang Lang Plays Disney in Concert, The Star Theatre, The Star Performing Arts Centre. Tickets from $38.

7. Peter & Blue’s School Holiday by Singapore Ballet

The Singapore Ballet’s fun new character Peter and his faithful dog, Blue, return to the stage on an exciting journey of fun and discovery in ‘Peter & Blue’s School Holiday’! This heartwarming production especially for kids follows Peter and Blue as they embark on a series of thrilling adventures during the school holidays. Filled with laughter, friendship, and imaginative play, this fun show is perfect for young audiences and families to enjoy the ballet together.

When: 26 – 29 June 2025
Where: Peter & Blue’s School Holiday, Singapore Ballet, Esplanade Theatre Studio. Tickets $35.

8. Bjorn Again

Anyone else a die-hard ABBA fan? We’re in for a treat this July as the world’s Number One ABBA show is coming to Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands for three dazzling, high-energy performances. This Super Trouper event will feature ABBA’s greatest hits, including Dancing Queen, Mamma Mia, Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight) and SOS, along with iconic songs from the Mamma Mia movies. With stunning costumes, non-stop fun, and a perfect blend of nostalgia and celebration, Bjorn Again’s performance promises to create an electric atmosphere and an unforgettable experience. I can’t wait!

When: 13-14 July 2025
Where: Bjorn Again, Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands. Tickets from $69.

9. The Lord of the Rings: A Musical Tale now on sale

I’m not much into The Lord of the Rings, but this collision of theatre and music based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s iconic trilogy sounds intriguing. The Lord of the Rings: A Musical Tale is making its highly anticipated Asia premiere at Sands Theatre at Marina Bay Sands this August. Fans of the series won’t want to miss this stunning new journey, as The Lord of the Rings unfolds in a breathtaking and critically acclaimed live stage production!

When: 12 – 24 August 2025, various showtimes
Where: The Lord of the Rings: A Musical Tale, Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands. Tickets from $68.

10. DATE NIGHT: Queen It’s a Kinda Magic Concert, on sale now

There’s something timeless about Freddie Mercury, and hit after hit from supergroup Queen. Now the teens can feel the joy of this music too, as this live tribute concert makes its way to Singapore this September. My personal fave, Bohemian Rhapsody, is set to rock the stage, along with We Will Rock You, We Are the Champions, Radio GaGa, I Want to Break Free, Somebody to Love, Don’t Stop Me Now, Another One Bites the Dust, and of course, A Kind of Magic. Starring international stars Warren Vernon-Discroll as Freddie and Rusty Red as Brian May, I’ll be hot-footing it over to Sistic asap to book my date night tickets for this one!

When: Friday 19 and Saturday 20 September 2025
Where: Queen It’s a Kinda Magic Concert, Marina Bay Sands. Tickets from $68. No admission for children aged under 12 years.

11. Cirque Alice, from the creators of Cirque Du Soleil’s Mad Apple and Broadway’s The Illusionists

Ready to go on an adventure down the rabbit hole? Cirque Alice is making its debut in Singapore this October 2025, reimagining Lewis Carroll’s classic adventure and bring to life everyone’s favourite characters from Alice in Wonderland with extraordinary acts! I’m looking forward to an awe-inspiring set in this immersive experience with a world-class lineup of acrobats, mesmerising aerialists, mind-bending contortionists, exquisite puppetry, talented dancers, special musical guests, comedic artists, and more.

When: From 9 October 2025, tickets now on sale via MBS, SISTIC and Klook from $78!
Where: Sands Theatre, 10 Bayfront Ave, B1-69/70 The Shoppes, Marina bay sands, Singapore 018971

12. Dear Evan Hansen on sale now [Advisory 16]

Deep issues facing our teens today are the theme of this acclaimed musical, packed with some of the biggest musical theatre songs of the last decade. The story follows Evan, an anxious high school kid who wants nothing more than to fit in. On his way to fitting in, he didn’t tell the whole truth, and now he must give up on a life he never dreamt he’d have. As events spiral and the truth comes out, Evan faces a reckoning with himself and everyone around him. We love that for this production, in the spirit of Dear Evan Hansen and its powerful message of connection, there’ll be a special seating category for single theatre goers. ‘You Are Not Alone’ is a dedicated section of 56 seats reserved exclusively for solo ticket holders. Coming to the theatre alone should feel just as welcoming and exciting as coming with a group. So take a seat, enjoy the show, and mingle with fellow theatre lovers when flying solo!

When: 30 October – 16 November 2025
Where: Dear Evan Hansen, Sands Theatre, Marina Bay Sands. Tickets from $68 – $228

13. NEW ON SALE: Disney’s Beauty and the Beast, The Musical

It’s time for an adventure in the great, wide, somewhere! Beauty and the Beast is set to enchant audiences in Singapore later this year, and the waitlist is now open to secure the best seats in the house. This brand-new production of Beauty and the Beast The Musical will be making Singapore its only stop in Asia this December. From the same producers and presenter of The Lion King, Aladdin and Frozen, the timeless tale of Belle and the Beast will be brought to life with spectacular new sets, costume designs, and state-of-the-art technology. Add a fantastic cast and the nostalgic and spellbinding songs of Alan Menken and Tim Rice, including ‘Be Our Guest’, and this is sure to be a show to remember!.

When: 11 December 2025 – 4 January 2026
Where: Beauty and the Beast, Sands Theatre. Tickets from $70.

14. Candlelight Concert Series

Enjoy the various songs that you know from the movies being performed live at this concert! Imagine: candlelights all over the venue, a solo pianist, and you humming along to the tunes featured in classics such as Aladdin, Frozen, Harry Potter, and many more. I always feel like I’ve been transported to a whole new world by the end of these shows – I’m a repeat audience member, with lots of iconic venues around Singapore. Perfect date night or special experience with friends (or older kids who can appreciate the beauty of it all).

When: Various showtimes
Where: Candlelight: Concert series, Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall, Chijmes, S.E.A. Aquarium and others

15. FREE: Gateway Arts Theatre Kids Storytelling Sessions every Saturday!

Gateway Kids Club is a free programme held at Gateway Theatre every Saturday. You can also join the Arts and Crafts session or Free Play activities after the storytelling session! Each month features a different theme around which activities are focused. It’s one of the best kids theatre shows in Singapore. Book your tickets via Sistic before you go. This month, the stories are all themed around ‘Capeless Heroes’.

Psst… English Storytelling will begin at 10am, and Chinese Storytelling will be held on the first Saturday of each month at 11am. Tickets can be booked at no cost and admit one person per ticket.

When: Every Saturday, 10am
Where: Storytelling, Gateway Arts Theatre, 3615 Jalan Bukit Merah Singapore 159461

Head to our big sis Honeycombers for more about the concerts for adults in Singapore. Stay tuned as we’ll update this piece throughout the course of the year on other kids’ theatre in Singapore offerings!
