item.content:encoded:
Guide to Children’s Season 2025: Discover home, community, and country through play

Play is so important for a child’s development and well-being. And it’s wonderful that we have facilities like water parks, nature parks, and even playgrounds peppered around the island for free play. But this June holidays, we’ll be hitting the museums. Because Children’s Season 2025 is back with an exciting lineup of free and ticketed activities held at the Children’s Museum Singapore (CMSG) and more.

The annual event, co-presented by the Children’s Museum Singapore and the Museum Roundtable, is designed to inspire the exploration of culture, heritage, and learning through fun and educational experiences. And who’s designing it, you ask? Well,  THE KIDS! This year’s lineup of signature programmes were co-created by CMSG and the students from Lianhua Primary School, together with Playeum. Based on a the criterion of humour, teamwork, and creativity, the panel of children selected from programmes they were pitched to. Later, they worked with the artists by sharing their ideas and feedback. They sure had a hand in shaping the programmes – curated by kids, for kids.

Big kids or small kids, we are just as excited about Children’s Season 2025. There will be four site-specific programmes, and the return of the ever popular Stamp Booklet activity. Find more free and ticketed activities at CMSG, presented by other partner museums. Here’s all you need to know about what’s happening, where and when to go. Tip: Since it’s a month-long festival, you’ll want to bookmark this page to plan ahead for the June school holidays.

Where: Children’s Season, various locations around Singapore including Children’s Museum Singapore, Indian Heritage Centre, MOE Heritage Centre, Singapore Maritime Gallery, KidsStop, and more
When: 31 May – 29 June
Price: Free and ticketed programmes, please read on for details

Children’s Season 2025: Signature programmes curated by the kids

For a Better Future at the Indian Heritage Centre (ticketed)

This is one of the top favourites of the children panel, with all of them raving about snakes! For a Better Future is a one-hour performance which revolves around the journey of three Indian migrants – a spice seller, an astrologer, and a snake charmer – who came to Singapore in hopes of a better life. An unlikely bond formed from the treacherous sea journey, but did it withstand the trial of hardships or did it support them in navigating this new life? You’ll have to play the roles of the textile trader, goldsmith, or dhobi to find out. Try your hand at making a flower garland or henna art before the show.

When: 31 May and 1 June, 10.30am and 3.30pm on both days
Where: Indian Heritage Centre, Activity Room, 5 Campbell Lane, Singapore 209924
Price: Tickets run $25/ person; $80/ bundle for 2 children + 2 adults
Duration: One hour
Recommended age: 5 to 12 years old

Alien Vacation: A Cosmic Adventure (Ticketed)

Have you ever wondered what it takes to be human? Well, think hard because in Alien Vacation: A Cosmic Adventure, you’ll be teaching an alien how to be one! This musical adventure will spark your imagination as you explore the cosmos and themes of friendship. You’ll be snapping up pictures with a mini toy camera, which you can take home after the workshop.

When: 14 June 10.30am; 20 June 3.30pm; 21 June 10.30am & 3.30pm
Where: KidsSTOP, Science Centre Singapore, 21 Jurong Town Hall Rd, Singapore 609433
Price: Tickets run $25 per person; $80 per bundle for 2 children + 2 adults 
Duration: One hour
Recommended age: 4 to 8 years old

Class from the Past (Ticketed)

Inspired by escape rooms, Class from the Past is a puzzle-solving performance that sends you back to the time when you, the parent, were a student. Relive the good old days with your younglings as you flex your childhood memories to solve the puzzles. This parent-child activity is great for bonding and finding common interests, such as the love of play. It’s run at the MOE Heritage Centre and you’ll understand why when you’re there.(hint: remember the OHP? IYKYK)

When: 31 May 10.30am; 6 June 3.30pm; 7 June 10.30am and 3.30pm
Where: MOE Heritage Centre, MOE office building at 565 Balestier Road, S329927
Price: Tickets run $25 per person; $80 per bundle for 2 children + 2 adults 
Duration: One hour
Recommended age: 6 to 12 years old
Note: Bring along a photo ID for everyone who is seven years old and above

Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey (Ticketed)

If there’s one thing that draws Singaporeans together, it’s our love for food. With everyone hunting down the best food, eating is almost like our national hobby. But we know little about our heritage foods. In Tools and Treats: A Tasty Journey, we trace the origins of heritage snacks like Ang Ku Kueh, Puteri Ayu, and Murukku through movement, storytelling, and hands-on play. Recreate the traditional snacks with playdough and bring them home!

When: 7 June 10.30am; 13 June 3.30pm; 14 June 10.30am & 3.30pm
Where: Singapore Maritime Gallery, 31 Marina Coastal Dr, Level 2, Singapore 018988
Price: Tickets run $25 per person; $80 per bundle for 2 children + 2 adults 
Duration: One hour
Recommended age: 5 to 12 years old

Children’s Season 2025: Fill up your Stamp booklets for prizes

Want a chance to redeem some cool Children’s Season merch? Collect your stamp booklet from any of the 22 museums listed below, complete simple activities at each museum, get a stamp, and receive some goodies. Don’t just stop there, collect 5, 10, or 15 stamps and you’ll be able to redeem cute items like a customisable water bottle, luggage tags, tattoo sheets, sticker sheets, and more.

1. Asian Civilisations Museum
2. ArtScience Museum
3. Children’s Museum Singapore
4. Eurasian Heritage Gallery
5. Former Ford Factory
6. Fort Siloso
7. Indian Heritage Centre
8. KidsSTOP
9. MOE Heritage Centre
10. National Gallery Singapore
11. National Library Board
12. National Museum of Singapore
13. Peranakan Museum
14. Science Centre Singapore
15. Singapore Art Museum
16. Singapore Discovery Centre
17. Singapore Maritime Gallery
18. Singapore Mobility Gallery
19. Singapore Navy Museum
20. Singapore Sports Museum
21. The Gem Museum
22. The Intan @ T-play

Children’s Season 2025: Fun activities to look out for at the Children’s Museum Singapore

Did you know that 11 June is the International Day of Play? It’s a day proclaimed by the UN to champion every child’s right to play and this year, it’s a reminder to “Choose Play – Everyday.” Besides the ongoing Hawkerverse exhibits at Children’s Museum Singapore, there’ll also be free play with LEGO – Build the Change on 11 and 18 June, where kids can build their very own playful cities. Come 12 and 19 June, Beyond the Doh lets you recreate your favourite Singaporean food with Play Doh and bring them home!

Where: Children’s Museum Singapore, 23-B Coleman Street,  Singapore 179807
Price: Admission to the museum is free for citizens and permanent residents; $10+/ child and $15+/ adult for foreign friends. Some programmes are ticketed, please read below for more details.

Armenian Street Adventures with Bloopy and Friends (Free)

Bloopy is an alien who has runaway from home and his spaceship crash landed into a wok of char kway teow! He is stranded on an unfamiliar planet (at least, he smells delicious!) and you’ll have to help him resolve his family conflict with care and most importantly, find his way back home. Grab your free mission booklet from CMSG and head to the installations at Armenian street in a self-guided mission to solve the puzzles. The comic-style booklet is good enough to read (after the game) and parents, it might be a useful tool when you need to speak with your children about their emotional world.

Where: Armenian Street, collect your mission booklet from Children’s Museum Singapore. Expect slight walking around Armenian Street – bring hats if you’re visiting in the afternoon.
Price: Free

Char Kway Teow Rhapsody (Ticketed)

Inspired by the iconic char kway teow stall that once stood on Armenian Street, this immersive experience lets kids dress up as ingredients, interact with installations, and move through different “stations” filled with sizzling sounds and food aromas. The journey begins and ends at the Children’s Museum Singapore, where little ones can learn about our culinary heritage through multi-sensory fun. Just imagine how cute they’ll look as food!

When: 31 May, 1, 6, 7, 8, 13, 14, 15 June, 2pm – 4.30pm
Where: Starts at Children’s Museum Singapore, moves to Armenian Street and Lewin Terrace
Price: Tickets run $35/ person; $1100/ bundle for 2 children + 2 adults
Duration: One hour 30 minutes
Recommended age: 6 to 12 years old

Drop-in crafting activities (Free)

Get those little hands busy with crafting activities in the Discovery Room on level two.

Craft a 3D Paper Lighthouse

Learn all about the importance of lighthouses and don’t forget to collect a redemption flyer to get a complimentary comic book ‘The Little Known Wonders of Maritime Singapore’ at the Singapore Maritime Gallery.
When: 4, 12, and 18 June
Recommended age: 5 to 12 years old

Paint with Gems

Select three gemstones and use them in a one-of-a-kind gem painting experience. Using acrylic paints, children will create unique art pieces which they can bring home.
When: 5, 11, and 19 June
Recommended age: 7 to 12 years old

The Time Traveller’s Guild

Science meets imagination in this activity where children will learn the secrets of machines and have a go at designing part of a time-travelling machine. All creations will be pieced together and displayed at KidsSTOP from 30 Sep to end of Dec 2025. Activity is free but pre-registration is required.

When: 25 and 26 June
Recommended age: 4 to 8 years old

Enjoy all the fun of Children’s Season 2025!

item.content:encoded:
Father’s Day 2025: The coolest gifts and presents you can get for Dad

We think it’s fair to say that the man folk are way harder to buy for than us mums, but perhaps we’re a little biased. Struggling for ideas? That’s where this handy Father’s Day gift guide comes in, filled with the coolest presents you can buy for Dad right here in Singapore.

All the best gifts for Dad this Father’s Day 2025!

1. For the active dad who loves sports

Is Dad the outdoorsy type? If going for a run or cycling in parks is the perfect day for Dad, then look no further than a sports-inspired gift for Father’s Day 2025! New running shoes are always a good idea, and the running pros always recommend styles from Under Armour, Asics and Nike.

Is Dad a major stats geek? Get him a piece of wearable tech that’ll make him really happy! Our top picks? How about a fancy Fitbit Charge 6? It lets you see your heart rate in real-time when you connect it to your favourite compatible exercise machines, has 40+ exercise modes- including strength training and kayaking, and comes with built-in GPS with many other features. Or how about Garmin’s Vivoactive 6? It’s a GPS smartwatch that monitors your health 24/7, including stress, sleep and more. Pretty cool! You can also consider the Xiaomi Watch S1 Active. It contains 117 fitness modes and 200+ watch faces with many other features.

2. For the dad who likes gadgets and to read in peace

Time to update the E-Reader! Look no further than the Rakuten Kobo, which comes highly recommended for travelling (the perfect size for a holiday!), has a backlit screen and adjusts for nighttime reading, so it’s easier on the eyes. There are also some fab accessories to go with it, including attractive cases made of recycled ocean plastic!

3. For the dad who likes (and has) to look his best

Whether it’s showing up to the office or attending work calls from home, Dad’s gotta look clean and good for work! Get Dad some pre-shave, safety razors, aftershave and more from local hip barbershops like The Panic Room or Sultans of Shave. And if Dad’s game enough for someone at home to cut his hair, you can even grab a pair of clippers, too!

If you are scouting for something more stylish and plush, ‘What He Wants’ has the ultimate grooming set any Dad would go gaga over. Think Gentlemen’s Tonic pre-shave oil, traditional shaving cream, aftershave balm, a Mayfair shaving set and a badger brush. Besides all this loot, the nifty grooming set comes in a nifty presentation box for the ultimate gifting surprise.

4. For the stylish and fashionable dad

Got a stylish dad on your hands? Shop for a new pair of socks, a new tie or a new pair of sunglasses to up his fashion game this Father’s Day. Our pick of the lot? Shades from local eyewear company, The Rocket Eyewear Company – it has sunglasses and eyeglasses with raised “Asian” fit and “European” fit, which makes it suitable for all dads! Plus, it’s super stylish and chic – we might just cop a pair for ourselves, too.

And if Dad loves a good hat, take a peek at Hat of Cain’s Panama Hat collection. These handcrafted hats add flair to an outfit and are perfect for the hot weather here in Singapore… and the next beach holiday! But if all else fails, grab Dad a pair of spiffy socks from the folks at Talking Toes. You can never go wrong with a good pair of socks! How about a brand new watch to refresh his wardrobe?

5. For the Dad who loves to accessorise

Now that you have the outfit sorted, how about snagging the finishing elements to complete Dad’s look? We can’t get enough of this nifty Dante II, Black Skeleton timepiece with the interior gold-tone movement that ought to have him ticking the streets with style. Finish off with a snazzy Polo Ralph Lauren belt from FarFetch to give Dad that strapping good luck. And with that, he’s good to go!

6. For the Dad who carries that nifty bag

Dads might be content with just a wallet in their pockets, but with these snazzy bags on offer, don’t be surprised to see him flip like a coin. We can’t get enough of the Delton leather bag from Trendhim for its rustic creased finish. We can totally picture Dad painting the town red with his schmancy new pressie! Looking to gift wrap something smaller in size? The chic urban style Sling Mini from Bellroy is a great choice to maintain clean lines and a sophisticated look for Dad. Psst…the bag is unisex by design. Our advice? Hide it away from all prying eyes at home when not in use. Otherwise, you know what might happen!

7. For the sentimental dad

We love a good ol’ DIY Father’s Day gift or card, but why not take it up a notch with a photo book or mug featuring Dad and the fam? Photobook Singapore has some great options (that are super affordable too!) and we like the ease of ordering multiples for all the different dads in the family – including Grandpa, uncles and more!

8. For the dad who’s tech-obsessed

Since the start of the pandemic, we’ve all been relying on technology a lot more than usual. Some dads, however, were long on the tech bandwagon before the rest of us and have been obsessed with the latest gadgets that can make home living futuristic. Sound familiar? If so, this Father’s Day, you’ll want to grab Dad a set of Tile Pro trackers in case he loses his keys, wallet and other essentials around the house. Or, make Dad’s life a little simpler with Belkin’s three-in-one wireless charging pad – it’ll charge his Airpods, iPhone and Apple Watch from one central location. We’re also loving the cool Canon SELPHY CP1500 photo printer which turns memories into tangible keepsakes for the whole fam! Mums, you’ll love this one too.

9. For the music fan dad

If Dad is all about the music, how about a nice speaker with a good bass output and crisp sound while listening to his favourite hits? Check out Bang & Olufsen’s Beolit 17 for a portable and home option. Or, for a style statement, how about these transparent speakers from Ante? Made from tempered glass and aluminium, they are pretty fancy and even better – sustainable. The speakers are forever upgradable – you can swap out the existing system with new components. If Dad likes to keep music time to himself, a snazzy pair of Sony WH-1000XM6 headphones will make him giddy with excitement – these are the latest from Sony’s 1000X series.

10. For the gamer dad

Is Dad as big of a gamer as the kids are? If so, we’d suggest a console, but chances are, Dad has probably shelled out for a PS5 or pre-ordered the Nintendo Switch 2. If so, you’ll want to grab the newest games for him to while his time away. Maybe Dad isn’t much of an online gamer but prefers board games instead. To that, we say, check out our article for a list of fun board games to entertain the whole family!

11. For the cool-at-the-pool dad

To those lucky folks who have a pool at home or a bathtub large enough: we are envious. Still, it doesn’t mean we can’t dress up at home like it’s pool day! Plus, living in tropical Singapore means year-round sunshine, so there’s always a good reason to get Dad a pair of board shorts. Check out August Society, Tom & Teddy or Mantorai for some snazzy swimwear Dad will love. With so many colourful options to pick from, Dad will be the coolest dad in the room (and the pool) for Father’s Day 2025.

12. For the foodie dad

Is your dad a typical foodie and won’t stop raving about his famous dish? Or how about the hottest new recipe that he can’t wait to try out? Perhaps he’s the master baker of the household, with an arsenal of baked goods waiting to be devoured? Well, good news for foodie dads: he’ll love Le Creuset‘s cast-iron skillet, Christopher Tan’s The Way of Kueh, a collection of recipes of Singapore’s traditional desserts, or father of five Jamie Oliver’s latest cookbook, Simple One-Pan Wonders could be a great source of inspiration to Dad. Yum – we can’t wait for a feast.

If Dad prefers to sit back and relax (he totally deserves it!), we suggest hitting up one of these restaurants for a hearty Father’s Day meal that he will love.

13. For the travel-mad dad

If your dad is all about travel, then help him plan new ones for the future! For travel memories, check out this PAIFIEVD WiFi Photo Frame. It’s easy peasy to upload images from your phone, and it can take centre stage as it’s standing and wall mountable. Plus, it’s got loads of fancy features that we think Dad will love – like playlists and ambient light sensors, fancy! Or, if you think Dad might appreciate some inspo for future hols, how about this travel book by intrepid explorer Anthony Bourdain? And if Dad really needs a hol but doesn’t have time to go overseas, don’t forget about the whole host of staycays on your doorstep in Singapore!

14. For the dad who likes a well-stocked bar

There’s nothing like having a chilled bevvy at the end of a long day… especially after a day of daddy daycare over the school hols! We say bring the bar home and let Dad unwind and relax with a tipple in hand from EC Proof. Stock up on tools of the trade, glassware or Dad’s favourite spirits. You can’t go wrong with this.

Psst, if Dad loves a good craft beer, have your pick of four- and six-packs from local breweries like Off Day Beer, Trouble Brewing, Lion Brewery, or Rye & Pint. And what better way to cheer the old man than with a custom gift box from Thirsty? It’s fair to say there’s plenty to choose from. It’ll defo show him that you love him beer-y much. Cheers!

15. For the Dad who loves a good BBQ

If Dad is the type who loves to stand at the grill to dish out all your sizzling faves (no complaints there), then a set of snazzy BBQ tools is sure to make his day. The BBQ Grill Store is your place to hit up for all the grilling accessories he will need. From multifunctional skewers to heat-resistant BBQ gloves and even heavy-duty Rotisserie kits, the options are endless. Did we mention The BBQ Grill store also has some pretty handy grilling tips and recipes that Dad might love to try out too?

16. For the Dad who loves camping with the fam

If camping with the fam excites Dad, we know just the pressies he will love to pack for the next camping trip. Decathlon, Campers’ Corner or Outdoor Life are a camper’s one-stop-shop for all camping gear and essentials. And the stores stock some pretty cool tools and accessories that could come in handy, from flat-fold silicon storage ware to 2-bedroom camping tents. Our advice? Look through all the gear already at home before hitting the stores to add to the camping stash.

17. For the dad who likes to sleep in

Does Dad want to slumber it through Father’s Day? Here’s that perfect gift to surprise him with for his ultimate day of rest. A soft and luxurious bamboo fibre eye mask by Heveya accompanied with essential oils to ease Dad into blissful sleep and a hypoallergenic bamboo pillow case too. Whoever wants to count sheep with these snazzy ops at hand?

18. For the Picasso Dad

Does Dad have the constant itch in his fingers to doodle something now and then? We know just the pressie that he will love for Father’s Day. The Draw with Dad! The Two-Person Doodle Book is a great book for a Dad-kiddo team to express their creativity together. Based on 100 creative prompts Dad and his tiny sidekick can doodle away a composition together to create a memorable masterpiece.

19. For the coffee-holic Dad

With an over-flowing calendar and tons to do each day, this pressie will have Dad energetic in a jiffy to hit the day with a war footing. The Wacaco Minipresso GR Espresso Coffee Maker is not only nifty in design but is lightweight, portable and has a 70 ml water capacity. Best part? Dad can get his kick from any coffee bean/roast of his choice! Did we mention it can even grind coffee beans? So if it’s a long wait for the kiddos after soccer practice or a long wait in a traffic jam, Dad can reboot with a shot of energy like never before!

Happy Father’s Day, folks!

item.content:encoded:
Real Review: Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival 2025 (featuring Stitch!)

We are so excited for this! One of our favourite kids events in Singapore is returning, and entry is absolutely free! This year, step into a world of fun and imagination with four exciting installations inspired by ‘Lilo & Stitch’, perfect for little explorers!

About the 2025 Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival

This year, the Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival will feature Disney’s Stitch (from Lilo & Stitch) for the first time! This is a whole Stitch-themed outdoor festival, with large-scale installations and fun play areas. The Children’s Festival aims to teach kids ‘the importance of friendship and family, while learning to embrace and accept themselves for who they are.’

Key attractions at Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival

There is lots of fun to be had and photo opps galore at the Children’s Festival this year. We can’t wait to ‘surf’ down an almost 7-metre tall slide called The Great ‘Ohana Wave! In the Forest of Belonging, kiddos navigate an inflatable forest to uncover hidden messages. In a nod to Stitch’s extraterrestrial origins, little ones can embark on a Space Adventure. Get in on the fun and race swing cars to power up light beams and complete a space mission! The beachside fun of the story is brought to life with Stitch’s Mischief Makers. Here, kids can nurture creativity and sensory awareness through playing with kinetic sand.

Here’s what we know about the Stitch-themed attractions (most of which are completely FREE):

The Great ‘Ohana Wave

Ride into a sun-soaked adventure on a close-to-7-metres-tall slide! Kids can sit in an inflatable tube and wide their way around a Supertree – super fun! Take care though, this is a big slide designed for kids aged 6 to 12 years old, so there might be some sad faces from little ones who aren’t big enough to ride.

Forest of Belonging

Wander through a forest-themed inflatable playscape and discover the meaning of ‘Ohana

Space Adventure

Ready for launch? Power up as many light beams as you can in this cosmic challenge!

Stitch’s Mischief Makers

Unleash your inner mischief, get hands-on and creative with kinetic sand!

Entertainment at Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival

Meet and greets with Stitch!

Bring your camera and wear your brightest tropical outfit to meet Stitch in real life! Say aloha and share a shaka (and a big cuddle). Little ones won’t believe their eyes!

Where: Supertree Grove Lawn
When: 7 and 8 June 2025, 3:45pm, 4:45pm, 5:45pm and 6:45pm

Stage performances

Dancing, games and fun! Kiddos are sure to love the live performances happening on stage at the Supertree Grove Lawn. Catch The Great Island Series for a whirlwind performance of dance, games and silliness galore. Ride the waves of endless glee with a heap of sun-shine and super wild fun where everyone is in!

Where: Supertree Grove Lawn
When: 24, 25 31 May 2025 and 1, 14 & 15 June 2025. 5:00pm – 7:00pm. Free entry!

Carnival fun

There’ll be rides and games galore! Try your hand at the exciting games in the fun-filled Stitch-themed Carnival with games inspired by both space and island settings! There is no shortage of fun to be had here. Note that costs apply for the rides and carnival games – we’ll share the details here when we visit!

Workshops

If you’ve got crafty kids on your hands, then you’ll want to join in one of these super cool themed workshops! Create your own galaxy at the space lantern decorating workshop, or add some cheer and charm to your bags or keys at a floral wreath keychain making workshop. Little ones will love making their own ooey gooey slime, and designing their own ‘Intergalactic Sandscape’ one grain of sand at a time using coloured sand to craft galaxies, planets, nebulae and more!

When: Dates and times vary. Check for details and to register before you go.
Cost: From $15 – $18 per person 

Retail Pop-Up Shop

Fans of Lil0 & Stitch won’t want to miss taking home some super cute collectibles! Bring home a whole heap of adorable Lilo & Stitch themed merch, including special items that are exclusive to Children’s Festival at the retail pop-up. You’ll find the store located along the North Colonnade.

Special production of Garden Rhapsody: ‘Way to ‘Ohana’

Stay til after dark and see the Supertrees do what they do best – light up! When darkness falls at the Supertree Grove, be dazzled by a special edition of Garden Rhapsody inspired by Disney’s Lilo & Stitch – The Way to ‘Ohana. Immerse yourself in the stunning display of lights as the Supertrees illuminate and change colours in tune with familiar songs from the Lilo & Stitch soundtrack.

Where: Supertree Grove
When: 7:45pm and 8:45pm

Food and Drink options

We love to pack a picnic and enjoy snacks on the lawn at the Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival! Don’t forget the picnic blanket and bug spray. We’ll keep you updated on any food truck options and prices when we visit. Make sure you bring water bottles, hats and sunscreen for everyone, as the event is mostly outdoors!

Win tickets to the new Lilo & Stitch movie!

The Festival is just in time for the live-action reimagining of Disney’s Lilo & Stitch movie, which opens in cinemas on May 22. Take a creative photo with the 2 metre tall Stitch figurine inspired by Disney’s live-action Lilo & Stitch from 24 May to 8 June 2025 and stand a chance to win 4 movie tickets to Disney’s Lilo & Stitch, plus a pair of Lilo & Stitch stationery sets!

Getting There – Everything you need to know about public transport and parking during the Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival

As always, it’s best to get to Gardens by the Bay using public transport. The events are taking place around Supertree Grove.

To get to the Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival by MRT:

The closest MRT station is Bayfront MRT Station (CE1/DT16) on the Circle Line (Yellow Line) and Downtown Line (Blue Line). Once you get off at Bayfront MRT, follow the signs that lead you to Gardens by the Bay. It’s a short walk (about 5-10 minutes).

To get to the Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival by bus:

The closest bus stop is Opposite Marina Bay Sands (Bus Stop No. 03239). Several buses stop here, including:

Bus 400 (Direct to Gardens by the Bay)
Bus 97, 97E, 106, 133, 502 (All stop nearby the entrance to Gardens by the Bay)

To get to the Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival by taxi:

The closest taxi stand is near to the main entrance Gardens by the Bay East Entrance (near the main Visitor Centre), close to the Flower Dome. When you arrive, turn left to head up the stairs (or take the lift) to go over the overpass to Supertree Grove.

Parking at Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival

The parking for Supertree Grove is located at Gardens by the Bay East (next to the Flower Dome and Cloud Forest). It’s quite convenient for visitors who drive. If you’re using GPS, the address for the carpark is 18 Marina Gardens Drive, Singapore 018953.

Parking Rates:

Weekdays (Monday to Friday):
Day (7:00 AM – 5:00 PM): SGD 0.60 per 30 minute
Evening (5:00 PM – 11:00 PM): SGD 0.80 per 30 minutes

Weekends (Saturday and Sunday):
Day (7:00 AM – 5:00 PM): SGD 0.60 per 30 minutes
Evening (5:00 PM – 11:00 PM): SGD 1.00 per 30 minutes

Enjoy the 2025 Gardens by the Bay Children’s Festival and have fun making memories!

item.content:encoded:
Best party planners, entertainers and rental services for kids’ parties in Singapore: Magicians, clowns, face painters, bouncy castles & more

We do love a good birthday party. Whether we’re hosting one or going to one, we love the magic of a happy child and a really good slice of cake. But what makes the best party? A bouncy castle? A photo booth? Face painting and magicians? All of the above? Whether you’re planning a celebration at home or throwing a bash at one of these rockin’ party venues, fun activities and good entertainment are key to keeping the kids enthralled, happy and the talk of the classroom the next day. So, to make that magic happen, you’re going to need our guide to the best party planners and best kids’ party entertainers in Singapore. We’re talking about the bounciest bouncy castles, the funniest magicians, the most talented face painters and the biggest photo booths in the party entertainment world – all right here in Singapore!

Best kids’ party entertainers in Singapore: Face painters, balloon sculpting & more!

1. Lucy Sparkles & Friends

If you’ve been in Singapore a while, chances are you’ve heard of Lucy Sparkles & Friends. As well as being awesome kids’ party entertainers (we can vouch for them), they also provide high-quality drama, music and dance classes. Originating from the UK, you can expect uber-creative and imaginative activities to enthral your little partygoers. There’s everything from singing, dancing, glitter tattoos, party games, bubbles, and so much more! Is your little one a huge fan of a certain character? There are theme packages too! We love that they also offer sustainable options such as eco-friendly pass the parcel.

Details: Starting from $350 for a 45-minute booking. Suitable for 0-6 years old. Options for 45 minutes, one hour and two hours.

2. Jellybean Party

If you’re after a one-stop shop for party entertainment, you can’t go wrong with Jellybean Party. They’ve got all options, from magic shows to hands-on interactive workshops (because who wants to attempt a slime-making workshop on their own?). There’s a huge range of packages for all ages and stages, including toddler packages and add-ons like pinatas and balloons (if you want to get all your planning done in one fell swoop).

Details: Starting from $320 for the economy party package (including interactive games and side entertainment like balloon sculpting). Suitable for a range of ages and various package durations are available.

3. Party Heart Singapore

Party Heart Singapore has your kids’ party entertainment all wrapped up with everything from magic shows to balloon sculpting and so much more! In fact, you’ll be hard-pressed not to find something here – from candy floss to bouncy castles. We like that they offer an a la carte price list alongside packages, so you can pick and choose what suits you without it getting too $$$.

Details: Starting from $150 for glitter tattoos/face painting (60 minutes). Packages start from $400. Suitable for a range of ages and various package durations are available. 

4. Syrena – the Singapore-based mermaid

Here’s something a bit different when it comes to kids party entertainers, and it’s one for the mermaid fans out there – mermaid magic for Singapore-based mermaid, Syrena. As well as Syrena making an on-land appearance, your mini mermaids will also be treated to an activity of your choice: from storytelling and quizzes to a sparkly glitter tattoo session. There will also be mermaid swimming, pool games, and selfies galore! We’re in!

Details: Cost available on request. Suitable for all mermaid fans (but probably best suited to swimmers).

5. PartyAllo

PartyAllo is ready to fulfil all your party needs for any theme, any time of the year. With a wide range of party packages covering a range of kids entertainers in Singapore, pick from balloon sculpting, face painting, henna tattoos or glitter tattoos. Add some spice to the party with a piñata, carnival game booths, mascots and even a magic show. For the more ‘mature’ teens, an epic NERF battle party should do the trick.

Details: Starting from $470 for a package.

6. Happier Singapore

Happier Singapore offers face painting and body painting services using quality FDA-certified, hypoallergenic paint and glitter suitable for all skin types. Kids and adults can turn into whatever they wish: butterflies, Spiderman, dragons… or have their fave characters painted on their arms. As a nice take-home gift or a fun party trick, Happier Singapore also does balloon sculpting – the twisters can create anything from cuddly elephants and poodles to princesses and superheroes.

Details: Reach out to them for a quote on your next party. Suitable for a range of ages and various package durations are available. 

7. The Magic of Markson Kids Party

This one’s for die-hard magic fans: The Magic of Markson is a renowned magician in Singapore, thanks to his use of high-technology props, special effects and live birds. Choose from an interactive side-splitting comedy show with a drawing board illusion and audience participation. Or, a Vegas-style show with a 3D backdrop, LED light illusion and vanishing acts to keep your kids on the edge of their seats. It’s not just magic, though – there’s kids entertainment aplenty with balloon twisting, caricature, face painting, and more available!

8. Sweetheart the Clown

It’s not every day you see a female clown, much less one without all that make-up! In 2008, Sweetheart the Clown famously revamped her image and stopped using clown makeup to stop intimidating the little ones. As an accomplished ventriloquist, she also prides herself on being one of the fastest twisters in town, with an ability to twist a balloon into just about anything. A typical show of Sweetheart’s includes storytelling, mime, magic and fun balloons. We think this makes the perfect kids party entertainer!

The best kids’ party planners in Singapore

1. Makors Events

Bouncy castles, balloon sculpting, face painting, bubble entertainers – what doesn’t Makors Events have? They also have a wide range of themed party decor rentals to choose from if you haven’t decided on one yet –  let them handle the planning. Rent a photo booth and snap some pics to make some unforgettable memories, the little ones won’t stay little for long!

2. Party Mojo

With Party Mojo, you can be sure that every little detail will be taken care of. Whatever your party theme – nautical, pirate, lego – it can cater to them all! In addition, you can also opt for the carnival-themed package, which includes bouncy castle rental and free popcorn.

Where: Party Mojo, 2 Jurong East St 21, IMM Building #04-33V, Singapore 609601

3. Pegasus Experience (Closed)

The brains behind Pegasus Experience used to be an early childhood educator so you know that they’ve got what it takes to plan a great party for the littlies. Work hand in hand with them to plan everything out, down to the games and activities – they can even prepare arts and craft workshops for the partygoers to enjoy! Don’t sweat the small stuff and enjoy the special day with your kids and leave the party planning to Pegasus Experience.

4. The Party Elves (Closed)

Look to The Party Elves if you want to throw an unforgettable kids’ party. This bespoke party planning service has got everything covered so you can relax and enjoy the day. From coming up with your party theme, organising the catering, venue, invitations, entertainers, goodie bags and even cleaning up after the celebrations. The party planning service is famous for its attention to detail and dedication in helping you achieve absolute party perfection. The founder of The Party Elves is also a little bit famous – read about Aarathi Arumugam in our salute to Singapore’s mumpreneurs.

Rentals for bouncy castles and ball pits in Singapore

1. BouncyKiddoz

Why stick to just a bouncy castle – throw in a ball pit too for even more fun! BouncyKiddoz has over 10 designs of bouncy castles with ball pits to choose from to fit the theme of your party. They’re affordable too, starting off at $88 for two hours if you’re just looking to host a quick party for the kids. They also come with delivery and set-up so you don’t have to worry about a thing, just sit back and wait for the bouncy fun to begin!

2. Merry Bounce

You get to choose between four cute themes for your bouncy castle with Merry Bounce. They also have rental options by the hour or by the day, up to five days if you’re planning to have a week-long party. Plus if you opt for by the hour, there’ll be two-way delivery and they’ll even set it up for you. Otherwise, those opting for the daily rental will have to self-pick up at Paya Lebar or Bukit Batok and set it up themselves.

3. Party Mojo

If you’re looking to throw a party your kid’s friends (and other parents) will be talking about for years, Party Mojo has a whole slew of classic bouncy castles and variations to suit your child’s preference. What’s more, little Tarzans can unleash their inner jungle explorers on the Safari Bouncy, swashbuckling pirates ride aboard a ship, while princesses can finally live out their medieval fantasies from a fancy pink castle or carriage.

Where: Party Mojo, 2 Jurong East St 21, IMM Building #04-33V, Singapore 609601

4. SGBounceFun

You’ll be spoilt for choice with SGBounceFun, they’ve got bouncy castles, bouncy castles with ball pits, and just ball pits available to rent. Parents looking to go all out on something premium can choose from the Luxe series which includes an all-white castle, a ball pit with a slide, and a bubble dome with balloons floating around inside. They also have a party promotion that includes four hours of bouncy castle fun, 90 minutes of a live popcorn or cotton candy station, and 60 minutes of glitter tattoo or balloon sculpting!

5. Bouncy Castles & A Whole Lot More

Turn any venue into a party pad with Bouncy Castles & A Whole Lot More’s ample selection of party products. The company has loads of inflatables for rent, including bouncy castles, ball houses, dry slides and water slides, obstacle courses and games. If you’ve got a pool, rent out some instagram-worthy floats big enough to fit one or two kids and even up to 10 adults at a time. For a complete party set-up, Bouncy Castles & A Whole Lot More also provides balloons, decorating services, filled goodie bag, pinãtas, entertainers and carnival food.

Where: Bouncy Castles & A Whole Lot More, 253 Holland Road, Singapore 278602

6. Party Plus

The bouncy castles at Party Plus are very unique –  some have mini obstacle courses with wall climbing sections and slides, some have a mini inflatable Ferris wheel and there’s even a military-themed one! They also have ball pits and are the first in Singapore to offer a mobile soft playground for rental. These soft playgrounds are suitable for children as young as six months and are toddler-proofed – parents rest assured the toddlers are safe to crawl around within the fencing!

Birthday party photobooth rentals in Singapore

1. Aww Snap!

What sets these guys apart is customisation. Whether it’s a superhero or princess party theme, the in-house designers will do their best to accommodate your requests. Also, if you’re throwing a huge party, the No-Frills package includes a backdrop from Aww Snap’s inventory, a huge selection of props, on-site staff to guide guests, unlimited instant filmstrip printouts and even an online gallery where you can download digital versions of your pictures.

2. instantly

Break the ice between the kids (and parents) with a photo booth from instantly. All packages include unlimited printouts, a wide range of props, an option to include multiple photos in one printer and at least two friendly staff on site. It’s worth noting that the photo booth has specific requirements in terms of space needed and set-up time, so check ahead!

3. Hello Stranger

Preserve a moment in history with Hello Stranger’s high-tech photobooths with professional studio lighting and camera systems. Plus, each photo booth comes with a Hello Stranger backdrop (or you can use your own!). There’s also an ambassador to suggest hilarious poses as well as an online gallery for easy ‘gramming. Winner!

Ready to throw the kids’ birthday party of the century? Don’t forget to send us an invite!

item.description:

item.content:encoded:
#DinnerGoals, unlocked: Three simple chef-created recipes that you can cook with the kids

As Chef Gusteau from Ratatouille once said, “Anyone can cook.” And we at HoneyKids believe this applies to our kiddos as well.

If you have a toddler or preschooler like me, you’ll know that they love to feel useful and are always keen to help. So, why not let your little one help out in the kitchen? Cooking isn’t just an important life skill, it’s a great way to teach kids about healthy eating habits. Plus, it’s a fantastic way to get in some precious family bonding time. And you have an extra pair of (little) hands to get dinner sorted – win-win!

Keen to cook with the kids? We’ve got the perfect recipes to get you started. Don’t worry about the difficulty level, as they’re all beginner-friendly and suitable for kids as young as four years old. Best of all – these are all restaurant-quality dishes, crafted by the professional chefs at ANATTA Culinary Academy themselves!

Appetiser: Meatball marinara

Everyone loves meatballs, and you’ll be surprised at how easy it is to make. The kiddos will have fun making these too, as they get to help mix and shape them.

To make six meatballs, you need:

  • Olive oil
  • 112g ground beef, or meat of your choice
  • 14g egg
  • 7g grated parmesan
  • 6g breadcrumbs
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • ¾ teaspoon dried parsley
  • ⅛ teaspoon each dried oregano, dried basil, and black pepper
  • Shredded mozzarella cheese

And for the marinara sauce, you need:

  • Olive oil
  • ½ shallot, diced
  • 1 garlic clove, minced
  • 198g crushed tomatoes
  • 50g tomato paste
  • 50g water
  • 2 tablespoon mozzarella
  • ¼ teaspoon each dried basil, dried oregano, and black pepper
  • ⅛ teaspoon each sugar and salt

Let’s start cookin’:

  1. Kid-safe step: combine all the ingredients into a mixing bowl and mix everything until it’s well combined. Be careful not to overmix it as doing so will make the meatballs tough.
  2. Kid-safe step: Roll the meat mixture into balls, about one-and-a-half inch big.
  3. Heat a large fry pan on medium high heat, add some olive oil or fat of your choice, and start cooking the meatballs.
  4. Once they’re brown on all sides, remove the meatballs and put them on a baking pan or round tin.
  5. You can start pre-heating the oven to 180°C at this point.
  6. The same pan can be used to prepare the sauce – just add more olive oil into the same pan and put it on medium heat, then add the chopped onions and cook till they’re soft.
  7. Add in the minced garlic and cook until it’s fragrant, followed by the herbs.
  8. Stir in the crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, and water. Let it simmer for 10 minutes and stir occasionally.
  9. Kid-safe step: Pour the marinara sauce onto the meatballs in your baking pan or round tin, then sprinkle some shredded mozzarella cheese over. We say, the more the merrier!
  10. Bake for 10 minutes until the cheese is golden and bubbly.

Pro-tips from the chef:

  • Use a mix of ground beef and pork for extra flavour.
  • When shaping the meatballs, you may want to get the kids to put on gloves for hygiene purposes. Always make sure they wash their hands thoroughly before and after handling raw meat.

Main: Pumpkin gnocchi with nut-free basil pesto

This recipe puts a twist on the Italian dish by substituting the traditional potato with pumpkin, giving it a fun orange shade that will brighten your kids’ day. ANATTA’s chef also recommends to pair it with a basil pesto that’s nut-free, suitable for most diets!

To make one serving of pumpkin gnocchi, you need:

  • 102g flour
  • 86g cooked pumpkin
  • 1g salt
  • ⅛ teaspoon each salt, black pepper, and nutmeg

For the nut-free basil pesto, you need:

  • 45g olive oil
  • 30g Italian basil leaves
  • 24g canned chickpeas, drained
  • 12g parmesan
  • 1.5 garlic clove
  • 1g salt
  • ⅛ teaspoon pepper

Let’s start cookin’:

  1. Blend all the pesto ingredients in a food processor until you get a smooth green paste, then set aside.
  2. Kid-safe step: Mash the cooked pumpkin until you get a smooth texture. Then, mix in the flour, egg, salt, pepper, and nutmeg.
  3. Kid-safe step: Knead the mixture until a dough forms, then cling wrap it and let rest for five minutes.
  4. Kid-safe step: Roll the dough into 1.5cm x 2cm pieces – you have your gnocchi!
  5. Bring a pot of salted water to boil, then drop the gnocchi into it. You’ll know they’re fully cooked when they float to the surface.
  6. Heat a small pan with some olive oil and gently fry your gnocchi until they’re evenly toasted on all sides.
  7. Kid-safe step: Set your pumpkin gnocchi on a plate with a few tablespoons of pesto, remember to mix before you serve.

Pro-tips from the chef:

  • Don’t over knead or be tempted to add more flour to your gnocchi dough as this will result in a rubbery gnocchi. Your dough should feel soft and a little sticky.
  • You can lightly dust some flour to make handling the gnocchi dough easier for little hands.

Dessert: Fudgy brownies

When it comes to brownies, my kid and I are definitely on Team Fudgy. It’s just richer in flavour due to having more chocolate-y goodness over flour. I have a good feeling that this will be my family’s new favourite recipe.

To make a six-inch brownie, you need:

  • 196g light brown sugar
  • 130g each butter and dark chocolate
  • 128g eggs
  • 70g milk chocolate chunks
  • 60g plain flour, sifted
  • 30g cocoa powder or dark cocoa powder, sifted

Let’s get bakin’:

  1. Preheat the oven to 170°C.
  2. Melt your butter and chocolate on a bain-marie (in a bowl over a pot of simmering water) over medium heat and keep stirring. Remove from heat once the butter and chocolate have completely melted.
  3. Kid-safe step: Add the sugar and keep whisking until the temperature of the mixture drops below 55°C.
  4. Kid-safe step: Add in the eggs and whisk till it’s thoroughly combined.
  5. Kid-safe step: Add the sifted flour and cocoa powder, then mix until there are no visible traces of flour.
  6. Kid-safe step: Gently fold in the milk chocolate drops – this will give your brownies the awesome gooey texture.
  7. Pour your brownie mixture into a lined six-inch baking tin, then bake for 25 minutes.
  8. Once done, wait patiently (tough, we know!) for it to cool before serving.

Pro-tip from the chef: Opt for dark cocoa powder if you prefer a more intense chocolate flavour.

An exciting kids’ culinary bootcamp is coming your way this school holiday

If your kid has got a serious passion for cooking, they’ll want to check out ANATTA Culinary Academy’s upcoming Young Chef’s Academy: Passport To Flavour bootcamp. Starting on 2 June 2025 and through the local and international school holidays, this bootcamp will bring kids as young as four years old on a culinary adventure around the world as they learn how to cook iconic dishes from different countries. Think Mexican quesadillas, French cordon bleu, and American rocky road brownies. The course runs for four hours per day at $100; or you can sign the kids up for all five days for $400.

Prefer to join the kids? ANATTA has parent-child courses too that run on weekends and public holidays. You can learn how to make everything from sushi to cookies from $88 per class.

ANATTA also runs structured culinary enrichment classes during the school term (vs the bootcamp, which is conducted during school holidays), which are designed to focus on teaching 1 or 2 techniques through a recipe. This enrichment programme is conducted every Saturday throughout the school term.

All of its cooking courses are run by highly experienced chefs, with only five kids under an instructor. So rest assured that your kids will get maximum guidance and supervision in a safe learning environment.

Check out ANATTA Culinary Academy’s website for its full range of kids’ courses, and keep an eye out on its Facebook and Instagram (@anattaca.sg) for more updates.

ANATTA Culinary Academy, Neil Road Academy, 130 Neil Road, Singapore 088859; Sentosa Academy, 31 Ocean Way, #01-16 Quayside Isle @ Sentosa Cove, Singapore 098375

This post is in partnership with ANATTA Culinary Academy.

item.content:encoded:
Have you heard? You can now explore Shakespeare’s Macbeth on Roblox

Think you can experience Shakespeare’s plays through theatre productions and movie adaptations? Think again. Singapore Repertory Theatre (SRT) has truly outdone itself this time by recreating the world of Shakespeare’s Macbeth in Roblox’s virtual realm!

Something wicked (and cool) this way comes…

Macbeth on Roblox is the digital accompaniment for SRT’s Shakespeare in the Park – Macbeth show, created specially for teens. I personally think that this is a fantastic way to introduce Shakespeare to teens and young adults, as it presents the Bard’s Scottish play in a format that’s relevant and engaging for them. Proof that Shakespeare’s plays are anything but boring.

Plus, it’s mentioned that the game is designed with careful reference to Singapore Ministry of Education’s learning outcomes for the Literature in English subject that’s offered in local secondary schools. SRT even worked closely with the National Arts Council to make Macbeth on Roblox a material that teachers can use in the classroom, so students can actually put themselves in the shoes (or boots) of the main character.

I’ll admit it, as a former English literature student myself, I’m super jealous that students now have this learning experience!

Of course, we had to try it out – and here’s what we think.

If you’re familiar with the plot of Macbeth, you’ll know that there are some violent and scary scenes in the play (the three witches, murder, battle, etc.). As a mum, I’m curious as to how Macbeth on Roblox would present these instances since it has a ‘mild’ maturity label. After all, no mum would be happy with their teens playing a violent game, even if it does offer insights into a literary text they’re studying in school.

Without giving too much of the game away, you enter the game by playing Macbeth’s character, following Lady Macbeth’s instructions to retrieve the dagger and assassinate the king. This is where the game has swordfighting instances, but as stated in the maturity label, it’s mild violence and not gory at all.

But what really captured my attention was the fantastic voice acting, and the fact that the actual lines from the play are used. It really makes learning about Macbeth an immersive experience, as students get to experience the main character’s moral conflict and the gravity of events.

One of our Gen-Z writers, who is a seasoned Roblox player, tried the game out as well and found it quite intuitive. Like me, he was impressed with the voice acting, but remarked that the lines were too long, so much so that he kept skipping them.

Overall, it’s an interesting initiative; and I personally would like to continue playing it (during non-working hours, of course). However, I do think it’s suitable for students in upper secondary due to the mildly violent content and eerieness of the game.

Macbeth on Roblox is available for play now

Teens who are into Roblox, or those taking Literature in English, may really enjoy this game. Only Act Two of Macbeth on Roblox is available for playing right now, but fret not, SRT will be updating the game pretty soon.

But don’t limit the experience to just gaming, make it a family affair by bringing them to catch Shakespeare in the Park – Macbeth too. The show runs on Tuesdays to Sundays at 7.30pm from now till 1 June 2025 in Fort Canning Park, with ticket price starting at $60 per pax.

This post is in partnership with Singapore Repertory Theatre.

item.title: Father’s Day 2025: The best restaurants and takeaway options in Singapore for Dad!
item.dc:creator: Amanda Broad
item.description:
Father’s Day 2025: The best restaurants and takeaway options in Singapore for Dad!

Father’s Day is coming, and we’re excited to celebrate Dad all day on Sunday 15 June, 2025. We’ll be busy prepping a DIY card, planning an awesome day of activities and buying a gift just for him. But we could always do with a hearty portion of some of his favourite dishes too, or maybe […]
item.content:encoded:
Father’s Day 2025: The best restaurants and takeaway options in Singapore for Dad!

Father’s Day is coming, and we’re excited to celebrate Dad all day on Sunday 15 June, 2025. We’ll be busy prepping a DIY card, planning an awesome day of activities and buying a gift just for him. But we could always do with a hearty portion of some of his favourite dishes too, or maybe a special set menu at his fave restaurant. After all, there’s no better way to Dad’s heart than grub and drinks to go along with it!

Father’s Day 2025: The best Father’s Day breakfast, brunches, and food deliveries in Singapore

1. LeVeL33: A pint of beer and an indulgent meal

Reward Dad with a nice, cold pint of beer with a bird’s-eye view this Father’s Day! Check out the breathtaking Singapore skyline, and treat Dad to a sumptuous 3-course sharing menu. There’s an assortment of starters, followed by a succulent 30-day grain and koji dry-aged Black Angus ribeye steak (sourced in collaboration with Butcher Box!) Follow this up with one of three exciting upcycled grain and beer-infused dessert innovations. This 3-course sharing menu is available for lunch and dinner on 15 June, pre-order is recommended. Pssst.. try and grab a table outside, if you can, for a panoramic view of Marina Bay!

When: Sunday, 15 June 2025
Where: Level 33, 8 Marina Boulevard #33-01, Marina Bay Financial Centre Tower 1, Singapore 018981

2. Golf + Grill = Panamericana (plus kids dine FREE on Sundays!)

Treat dad to sweeping views of the sea and Sentosa Golf Club with a funky lunch or early dinner at Panamericana, the ultimate grill restaurant. Enviably set within a prime location of the golf club, the lawn tables book out quickly, but it’s worth it if you can nab a table outside to watch the sunset or feel the sea breeze. This is also a great takeaway option, as the food travels really well (we know, we’ve tried it!). Best bit: Kids under 7 dine free on Sundays with the purchase of a long lunch platter!

When: From 12:00pm for lunch, from 5:00pm for dinner
Where: Panamericana, Sentosa Golf Club, 27 Bukit Manis Rd, 099892

3. Father’s Day at Lion Brewery Co

Get fired up for Father’s Day at Lion Brewery Co! If Dad is a beer drinker, this is the place to go to impress and spoil him at the same time. With it’s own on-site brewery, Dad can indulge in a wide range of beers while enjoying classic pub fare like beef sliders or fish and chips. Want to surprise Dad with a fun experience as a Father’s Day gift? Brewery Tours are available on  Mondays , Tuesdays, Fridays & Saturdays between 3.00pm – 5.00pm. Check out the menu here – there are some great options for the kiddos as well!

Where: Lion Brewery Co, 36 Club Street, Singapore 069469

4. Keep it casual with a big brekkie at Boomarang

We have lots of ideas for breakfast in bed, but if Dad’s an early riser, why not go for a walk along the river and treat him to a big breakfast at our favourite Aussie-inspired cafe, Boomarang. Kids can scoot along the pathways while dad relaxes with a coffee (or a beer… it’s 12pm somewhere!) and a guilty pleasure fry-up of sausages, eggs, beans and hash browns.

When: Open 6:00am – 3:00am daily
Where: Boomarang, 60 Robertson Quay, #01-15 The Quayside, Singapore 238252

5. Kaarla Wood-Fire Grill and Bar for a meat feast (and a free pint!)

Is dad a meat eater? Treat Dad to an unforgettable Father’s Day feast at Kaarla, featuring an indulgent array of premium meats and expertly grilled dishes, perfect for celebrating this special day. The Premium Meat Indulgence Menu features a generous selection of succulent cuts, all prepared in a woodfire oven, bringing out rich, smoky flavours and perfectly charred textures. As a special toast, Dad enjoys a complimentary pint of beer! Don’t forget to take a stroll around the epic kitchen garden and enjoy the 260-dgree views of the Singapore city skyline and beyond.

When: 14 June 2025, 6:00pm onwards
Where: Kaarla Wood-Fire Grill and Bar, 88 Market Street, CapitaSpring, #51-02, Singapore 048948

6. Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine for iconic Teochew dishes

If you’ve got Teochew parents or in-laws like mine, you’ll know how much they delight in celebrating with authentic Teochew cuisine. Not that it’s hard to find them in Singapore, but not many lives up to their discerning tastebuds. This Father’s Day, Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine makes it easy for us all with set menus starting from $388++ (for four persons). Filled with classic Teochew dishes like the Teochew Steamed Pomfret and a platter with favourites like Ngoh Hiang, Chilled Marinated Jellyfish, and the iconic Pig Trotter Terrine. One dish we always look forward to is the belly-warming Peppery Pig’s Stomach and Chicken Soup ($48++/half chicken, $96++/whole chicken). For a more immersive cultural experience, head to their sister outlet, Chui Huay Lim Teochew Cuisine , located within a century-old Teochew club, that’s steeped in elegance and tradition.

When: 6 – 15 June 2025
Where: Zui Yu Xuan Teochew Cuisine, 130/131 Amoy St, Far East Square, Singapore 049959

7. A tribute to parenthood at Choon Hoy Parlor

As a parent, seeing your child work his way to becoming a successful chef is one thing, but imagine them naming one of their restaurants after you! Which is why Choon Hoy Parlor deserves a mention in our Father’s Day dining list – not just taking the tribute to parenthood to the next level but also serving up good food. Run by Chef Dylan, who also runs The Masses next door, Choon Hoy Parlor celebrates Singapore’s culinary heritage with what he affectionately calls “Singapore Soul Food”. Recently relocated, you’ll find familiar local favourites like Satay, Rojak, and their signature Kampung Chicken (we love!), all crafted with a refined twist. That’s not all! We also really like how affordable their set lunch is – three dishes, one soup from just $18.90++. You’ll even get a choice of lard rice or plain rice. We say, go for the lard rice! Plus, we heard that the restaurant boasts the largest collection of baijiu in Asia, so, if Dad enjoys a drink, house pours starts from $8++ per 20ml.

When: Open daily 11.30am – 3pm, 5.30pm – 9.30pm
Where: Choon Hoy Parlor, 15 Stamford Rd, #01-84a, Singapore 178906

8. Say arigato with omakase at Ganko Sushi Singapore

While omakase dining is often associated with high price tags, Ganko Sushi Singapore offers a special Father’s Day Omakase that lets you indulge in premium Japanese fare without breaking the bank. Despite flying in top-quality ingredients from Japan three times a week, the experience starts at an accessible $98++ per person. ‘Omakase’ translates to “leave it to the chef,” and at Ganko, you’ll be in the expert hands of Chef Kuro, who curates a thoughtful, seasonal menu for each guest. Expect beautifully presented sushi and sashimi, as well as a standout Soumen dish with quail egg yolk and yam cream. To celebrate Dad, all fathers dining in will receive a complimentary Kuromitsu Pudding topped with Black Sesame Ice Cream Monaka—a sweet end to a memorable meal.

When: June 2025
Where: Ganko Sushi Singapore, 9 Penang Rd, #01-01, Singapore 238459

9. Fast cars and slow food at Torno Subito

If Dad is a fan of Formula One, he’s in for a treat at Torno Subito. Not one, not two, but three F1 cars are on display. Plus they have a three-course set lunch ($68++ per person) that’s named Formula Lunch, we think this might be the perfect spot to combine Dad’s love for cars with fine Italian dining! Led by the world-renowned Massimo Bottura, Torno Subito offers a playful, Riviera-inspired take on classic Italian cuisine. Feast on Genovese-style stuffed squid, Slow-cooked pink veal, and pasta like Traditional egg pasta with hand-chopped wagyu ragù. If the experience revs up more than just his appetite, consider picking up “Slow Food, Fast Cars”, Massimo Bottura’s lifestyle and recipe book featuring 85 authentic Italian recipes alongside a peek into his collection of Italian cars, interior design, and art. Our only gripe? The Formula lunch is only available for three days a week, but that just makes it feel all the more exclusive.

When: Wednesday – Friday, 12pm – 3pm
Where: Torno Subito, 26 Dempsey Rd, #01 02, Singapore 249686

10. A regal feast for the man of the family at The Black Pearl

Treat Dad to the heights of Cantonese fine dining at The Black Pearl, where the Father’s Day set menu draws inspiration from the imperial feasts of the Qing Dynasty. Priced from $128++ per person, this opulent seven-course experience features refined dishes such as the Black Truffle Crystal Dumpling and 10-Head South African Abalone Braised Rice—worthy of a modern-day emperor. Prefer a leisurely morning? Their Weekend Dim Sum Brunch is our top pick. Alongside staples like Honey BBQ Pork Buns and Fresh Shrimp Siew Mai, you’ll find unique offerings such as Shredded Duck Puff Pastry and Crispy Shrimp Rice Roll—a must-order in our books. Did we mention the breathtaking views at this rooftop restaurant?

When: Father’s Day Set menu runs from 1 -30 June 2025
Where: The Black Pearl, 333 N Bridge Rd, #07-11/12 Odeon 333, Singapore 188721

… While we wait for new Father’s Day menus, here are some of our faves from 2024

1. Special Father’s Day collab: Open Farm Community x boCHINche support the Rare Disorders Society

We’re so excited for this very special event featuring a collaboration between two well-renowned chefs in Singapore. For one night only, this six-course dinner has been specially crafted by Chef JD of Open Farm Community and Fabricio Mergalet of boCHINche. Bring dad along to enjoy an array of exquisite dishes, including koji-cured chicken heart skewers, and the smoked Argentinian “Gorina” tenderloin. Best bit: A percentage of the proceeds will benefit the Rare Disorders Society Singapore, making each bite a contribution to a worthy cause.

When: Friday, June 14 2024, from 6:00pm onwards
Where: Bochinche, 27 Club Street, Singapore, 069413
Cost: $108++ per person

2. Wine Connection

Wine Connection is one of our go-to happy hour spots for cost effective drinks and bar snacks, and they are coming to the party for Father’s Day! This year, Wine Connection honours the most important man in our lives with wine gifts galore and feasts befittingly fit for a king. We’e got our eye on the Father’s Day Feast with the Father’s Day Platter to share, with a 250g grain fed marble 2+ angus ribeye, two grilled Australian lamb racks, BBQ pork ribs, and farmer’s grill sausages. With french fries, mesclun salad and a choice of sauces, dad won’t go hungry this Father’s Day! Pair the platter with promotional prices on wines, including Zonte’s Footstep ‘Chocolate Factory’ 2020 Shiraz from Australia for an additional $39 (UP$48) or the Baròn de Ley 2016 Rioja Gran Reserva from Spain for an additional $49 (UP $58). Happy feasting!

When: Available 10 – 16 June 2024
Where: Wine Connection outlets islandwide
Cost: $65++ platter to share, wine priced by the glass / bottle

3. Yantra Father’s Day Menu with free flow beer!

We are big fans of this fun yet fancy restaurant hidden away in Tanglin Mall. With exotic decor, ambient lighting, and some of the best wall art we’ve seen in a restaurant, the Father’s Day menu is sure to impress. Smoky tandoor flavours, ultra fresh local seafood, and free flow beer are all winners in our book. Hurry, seats are selling fast for this one!

When: 15 and 16 June 2024 (lunch service only)
Where: Yantra, 163 Tanglin Road, #01-129/130/131 Tanglin Mall, Singapore 247933
Cost: $88 per person, add-on free flow beer $20 per person for 2 hours

4. Cantonese delights for Father’s Day from a celebrated chef at Ju Signature Dim Sum

Treat Dad to a Cantonese Feast this Father’s Day at Ju Signature Dim Sum, crafted by former Michelin Plate Holder Chef Wong Kok Shyong! The lineup features Cantonese delights meticulously prepared using the freshest ingredients. There are two set menus to choose from for either 4 pax (258++) or 6 pax (388++), available from 6 to 17 June.

The menus feature a variety of mouthwatering dishes such as a Father’s Day Treasure Platter with smoked duck. There’s also braised abalone and double-boiled sea birds nest with red dates and lotus seeds. Bonus: Receive a complimentary plate of Longevity Buns to share with Dad!

When: 6 – 17 June 2024
Where: Ju Signature Dim Sum take away menus
Cost: 4 pax $258++ or 6 pax $388++

5. Red House Seafood Restaurant Father’s Day meal

Celebrate Dad with an exquisite Singapore Nanyang-style seafood feast at Red House Seafood. Enjoy eight specially curated dishes, including unique prosperity longevity noodles,  “lo hei” style and other outlet-exclusive creations. Plus, with a minimum of six diners, enjoy a complimentary smoked lemongrass cage-free GG French chicken in a claypot dish!

When: 1 May to 30 June 2024
Where: Red House Seafood, outlets in Clarke Quay, Esplanade and Grand Copthorne
Cost: $98++ per adult

6. Father’s Day Brunch at Kwee Zeen

Spoil the man of the house with a decadent Father’s Day Brunch with over 90 mouth-watering selections. Indulge in a delectable spread of seafood, cold cuts, signature Asian dishes, and live stations before ending on a sweet note with a selection of tempting desserts.

When: 16 June 2024, 12 pm to 3 pm
Where: Kwee Zeen, Sofitel Singapore Sentosa Resort & Spa, 2 Bukit Manis Rd, Sentosa, Singapore 099891
Cost: $128++ per adult (food only), $64++ per child aged seven to 12 years. Children six years old and below dine free.

Happy Father’s Day!

item.content:encoded:
Artist’s Proof: Singapore at 60

Artist’s Proof: Singapore at 60 is a landmark exhibition and deeply personal tribute to Singapore’s founding leaders, told not through speeches or textbooks, but through art. Over the past decade, private collector Mr Chong Huai Seng has gathered artworks capturing Singapore’s transformation, from nostalgic street scenes to bold contemporary takes on identity and leadership. In celebration of Singapore’s 60th birthday, this ambitious exhibition features over 90 works by more than 50 artists, offering a fresh perspective of the Singapore story through the creative expressions of local artists from different generations. Featuring 10 new commissions by local artists and 1 brand new music piece, the exhibition underscores Chong’s passion in supporting young artists, seeking to inspire audiences to embrace local contemporary artists and invest in the growing potential of the future of Singapore’s arts through art collecting and patronage.

Chong’s love letter to Singapore traces its journey from a struggling young nation to a global city. Scenes of Singapore’s evolving cityscape unfold through paintings and photographs, while works inspired by Lee Kuan Yew and the founding fathers examine their legacy and impact on nation-building. The exhibition also looks inward, questioning the relationship between artists, the state, and its people.

Presented by The Culture Story and produced by Family Office For Art, Artist’s Proof: Singapore at 60 invites audiences of all ages and backgrounds to experience Singapore through the eyes of artists.

item.content:encoded:
Bhumi

Bhumi – A disability led dance theatre production

Bhumi, meaning “Earth” in Sanskrit, is a bold, powerful and inclusive new dance work that asks a deeply personal question:

If the world is our home, then why do so many of us still feel left out?

Created by Maya Dance Theatre and its inclusive wing, Diverse Abilities Dance Collective (DADC), Bhumi shines a spotlight on persons with disabilities as they share their lived experiences, challenge societal stereotypes, and reclaim their place within our communities.

Bhumi brings together artists from Indonesia (Gigi Art of Dance, Jakarta), Australia (Liz Lea Creates and The Stellar Company, Canberra), and Singapore (Under the Bridge Collective), with poetry performance theatre artist Verena Tay and Music Direction by Kailin Yong.

Together, we ask:
Can the world be a kind and safe space — truly accepting of all people, of all abilities?

Bhumi is more than a performance — it’s a conversation and call to action. It invites us to slow down, listen, and embrace one another with empathy and understanding to build a truly inclusive society.

Artistic Direction by Kavitha Krishnan in collaboration with the artists.

Singapore HeritageFest (SHF) 2025

Discover the vibrant tapestry of Singapore’s intangible cultural heritage at the 22nd edition of the Singapore HeritageFest (SHF). This year’s festival shines a spotlight on our nation’s rich living traditions, celebrating the dynamic and inclusive nature of our cultural practices. From our first UNESCO inscription, Hawker Culture, to the latest addition, the Kebaya, SHF2025 invites you to explore the essence of Singapore’s community-based traditions. Enjoy an immersive journey through interactive workshops, guided tours, captivating performances, and engaging exhibitions that bring these cherished practices to life.

item.content:encoded:
Bedrock Bar & Grill 2025 World Meat Series Edition II: Showcasing Mayura Station Chocolate-Fed Wagyu

Bedrock Bar & Grill returns with the second edition of its 2025 World Meat Series, spotlighting Mayura Station’s legendary full-blood Wagyu beef – renowned for its 500-day chocolate-infused diet. From 21 May to 31 July 2025, indulge in a 5-Course Tasting Menu ($138++ per person) featuring Mayura’s Japan Black Hair Wagyu, where cattle are raised on a unique blend of chocolate feed, yielding an exquisite beef marbling.

For the first time, Bedrock Bar & Grill has crafted an entire menu around the chuck eye roll – a showcase of how one cut of beef can be transformed across distinct dishes, each highlighting a different textural experience. The tasting menu begins with the Cured Beef Carpaccio, followed by Mini Beef Wellington; Red Wine Braised Chuck Steak; Grilled Denver Steak with sauteed spinach; and a decadent Salted Caramel Truffle.

Diners attending the launch night exclusive on 21 May 2025 will be treated to a complimentary 5-wine pairing from Montes, a renowned Chilean winery, curated to enhance each course. The wine pairing is available at a supplement of $88++ per guest for the remainder of the promotional period.

For those who wish to indulge in the prized Mayura Full-Blood Wagyu while enjoying other dishes in Bedrock Bar & Grill’s repertoire, the Smoked Full-Blood Wagyu Striploin (220g for $128++) and the Full-Blood Wagyu OP Rib (1kg for $320++) both highlight the quality of this esteemed beef.

Great Eastern Women’s Run 2025 Launch Event

Get Ready to Run! The Great Eastern Women’s Run 2025 Registration Launch Kicks Off 26 May!

Singapore’s iconic all-women’s run is back — and it all starts with the official registration launch on Sunday, 26 May 2025! Be part of the excitement as the Great Eastern Women’s Run (GEWR) marks its 19th edition with even more ways to celebrate strength, sisterhood and self-care.

To mark Great Eastern’s 117th anniversary, the first 117 women to register onsite at the launch event at Asia Square Tower 1 while wearing a GEWR race t-shirt from any of our past races will each receive a pair of free race slots — perfect for grabbing your bestie and running together. And that’s not all: the first 500 onsite registrants will receive an exclusive GEWR goodie bag. Everyone will also enjoy a 15% early bird discount across all race categories. Registration starts 12pm onsite and online, with the physical registration onsite closing 7pm. 15% early bird discount applies across all race categories till 8 June!

GEWR is more than just a race. It’s a space where women of all ages and backgrounds come together to prioritise health, build friendships, and share in the joy of movement. Whether you’re a seasoned runner, a first-timer, or a mum looking to bond with your daughter, GEWR has a category for you — including the newly introduced by-invite-only 10km competitive category for tertiary students!

Join us at the registration launch and feel the energy of a community that moves with purpose.

Sign up at greateasternwomensrun.com and follow Facebook @GreatEasternWomensRunSingapore and Instagram @gewomensrun for updates!

item.content:encoded:
Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning Mall Activations at Funan

ABOUT THE EVENT:
This May, CapitaLand is turning up the action at Funan with an adrenaline-pumping lineup of Mission: Impossible – The Final Reckoning themed experiences — perfect for movie buffs and thrill-seekers alike.

From 12 to 25 May, step into the world of espionage at the Mission: Impossible Activity Zone, located at Funan’s L1 Atrium. Test your skills across four spy-themed challenges inspired by some of the franchise’s most iconic moments. Shoppers who complete all four challenges will receive exclusive Mission: Impossible merchandise — limited to one redemption per person, while stocks last. Terms and conditions apply.

Challenge Highlights:

Race Against Time – “Mission: Light The Fuse”
Outrun the fuse and make it to the end in under 3 seconds.

Test Your Agility – “Mission: Reflex Rush”
Catch falling sticks as quickly as possible — only the fastest will succeed.

Stop The Timer – “Mission: Countdown”
Hit exactly 05:17 on the clock. Precision is everything.

The Impossible Stunt – “Mission: High Altitude”
Hang off a plane (safely, of course!) at our trick-eye photo zone and snap your gravity-defying moment.

For fans looking to dive even deeper into the world of espionage, don’t miss Mission: The Exhibition at Funan’s B2 Exhibition Space. Running now through 1 June, the showcase offers a visual journey through the legendary film series, complete with behind-the-scenes facts and unforgettable scenes from across the franchise.

DATE & VENUE:

Mission: Impossible Activity Zone: 12 – 25 May 2025, Funan L1 Atrium

Mission: The Exhibition: Now – 1 June 2025, Funan B2 Exhibition Space

TICKETING: Free
AGE LIMIT: Open to all ages

item.content:encoded:
Saturdate: May 2025 Edition

Sat 31 May 2025, 12pm – 5pm
Objectifs Annexe

Saturdate is a new programme happening on the last Saturday of the month that aims to create a gathering space of exploration, discussion and activities, highlighting the playful and creative forms of photography and filmmaking. Whether you are a young budding visual storyteller, or an experienced professional, there is something for everyone. The first 30 people receive a special stamp card to mark your progress with the activities! Complete 2 / 5 activities to get a 10% discount from our bookstore (T&Cs apply).

ACTIVITIES
1. Parent-Child Photo Hunt
All-day
Physical guide printout is pay-by-donation
On your marks, get the Photo Hunt Guide, go! Explore the Bras Basah district and complete a series of photography quests! These quests are designed to inspire young minds to look at fresh perspectives, and to create an adventure for them and their caretaker. After completing the photo hunt, claim your rewards at Objectifs.

2. Shrink Plastic Keychain Making Corner
2pm – 3.30pm
Minimum $5 donation per shrink plastic charm
Turn your favourite photos into wearable keepsakes! Watch your images and drawings shrink into little charms which can be made into keychains.

3. Jui Coffee
12pm – sold out
Sip on a freshly made handcrafted brew at a specialty coffee pop-up by Jui Coffee — the perfect way to unwind on a weekend.

4. Print Swap Station
All-day
Bring a photo print and exchange it with someone else’s print at our Print Swap Station! Discover new photographers, and get an exclusive photo print as a souvenir of time well spent.

5. SGSPC Off-The-Street Session: Post-GE2025 Discussion
2pm – 4pm | Free admission
Limited Slots Available, Please register via our website.
Took many photos during the election season? This is a great opportunity for you to share them with like-minded photographers and new friends!

Singapore Street Photography Collective (SGSPC) is established in 2020, and aims to showcase more street works from lesser-known SG-based photographers.

Pasar Charity 2025

Join us for Pasar Charity 2025, Chinatown’s first-ever community-driven street market where compassion meets action. Organised by the Chinatown Business Association, this 3-day event transforms the iconic Smith Street into a vibrant hub for local charities, social organisations, and everyday Singaporeans to come together in support of meaningful causes.

Discover an eclectic mix of pre-loved items, upcycled goods, and handmade treasures from booths run by participating charities and passionate individuals. Every item tells a story—and every purchase makes a difference.

Highlights:
– Shop with purpose and support causes ranging from elderly care to migrant worker support
– Learn more about impactful work by charities such as Jamiyah Singapore, Here With You, Presbyterian Community Services, and more
– Celebrate community spirit through giving, sharing, and connection in the heart of Singapore’s heritage district

Whether you’re a conscious shopper, a supporter of local causes, or just curious, Pasar Charity 2025 is your chance to make a difference in a uniquely Singaporean way.
