item.content:encoded:
Family-friendly dining around Orchard Road: burgers, pizza, local food and more

From top-notch burger joints to family-friendly pizza dates with the kids, easy-on-the-wallet local food to buffets, we’ve been out and about around Orchard Road on a mission to find family-friendly dining options and here are 17 of them – kids approved!

Where to eat with kids on Orchard Road

1. Little Farms Table at Tanglin Mall

We love Little Farms Table for their wholesome dishes made with fresh produce and we love them even more for catering to everyone in the fam. Besides a dedicated kids menu with food that’s fun to eat, think Berry Fun Pancake ($12++) and Cheesy Breakfast Quesa-Pocket ($13++), the placemat even comes with quick puzzles to keep the little ones busy. And of course, for adults, there’s the Avocado Smash on Sourdough ($23++) for breakfast and the Chicken and Cauliflower Rice ($27++) for lunch. Plus, they open really early too!

Where: 163 Tanglin Road #02-136 Tanglin Mall Singapore (247933)
Opening hours: Mon – Fri 7.30am – 3.30pm, 5pm – 9.30pm, Sat – Sun 7.30am – 9,30pm

2. Gyu San at Forum the Shopping Mall

This Japanese restaurant is also a supplier of top-quality Wagyu in Singapore, which is why you’ll find them in their sandos, burgers, and grilled selections. Gyu San does have a kids menu, but my son loves this place for its tableside charcoal grill. Order the Hamburg Set Meal ($25.80), which comes with two Wagyu patties, rice, salad, and miso soup, and you’ll get to grill the patties to your liking. Cooking with charcoal is a little more unpredictable than cooking on an electric grill (that’s where the fun is!), plus it imparts a light smokiness which makes the meal all the more delectable! There’s a hidden counter seating for its izakaya experience, think grilled meats, small bites, and of course, sake.

Where: 583 Orchard Rd, #01-28 Forum The Shopping Mall, Singapore 238884
Opening hours: Mon – Thu 11.30am – 10pm, Fri 11.30am – 12am, Sat 10.30am – 12am, Sun 10.30am – 10pm

3. Merci Marcel at Palais Renaissance

Orchard Road is almost always bustling, so when you find a spot that takes you away from it all, you know you’ve struck gold! The bright and airy space of Merci Marcel makes it the perfect spot to fuel up for a day out with the fam.  They open early enough for breakfast so you can dig into organic eggs – Scrambled ($21++) or Poached ($25++) – alongside hot bakes from the French bakery. They have an extensive lunch and dinner menu, as well as an Afternoon Break menu with French cheeses and cold cuts. Feel like you’re in France yet?

Where: 390 Orchard Road, Palais Renaissance, #01 – 03 / 04, Singapore 238871
Opening hours: Tues – Sat 8am – 12am, Sun – Mon 8am – 11pm

4. Pano Kato Grill, Pizza & Deli at Tanglin Mall

When it comes to Greek Mediterranean cuisine, Pano Kato’s one of our go-to restos. And it’s not just for its food or the bright tropical decor (a selection from House of AnLi just right upstairs!), but for its ultra kid-friendly service too! For starters, we love the extensive kid’s menu, which includes freshly baked wood oven pizzas, pasta, and souvlaki. The restaurant also offers children a complimentary playing set. That way, the kiddos can keep themselves occupied with the puzzle placemat, or start colouring with their new colouring pencils. Of course, you can bring these home too (major yasss!). But the best of all? Kids’ meals will always be served first at Pano Kato. No hangry kid = a happy, enjoyable family meal. Score!

Where: Pano Kato, 163 Tanglin Rd, #02-142/144 Tanglin Mall, Singapore 247933
Opening hours: Daily 11am – 10pm

5. Jolllibee at Lucky Plaza

If you’re looking to indulge in your fried chicken cravings, then you’ll have to make a beeline for Jollibee. The largest fast-food chain from The Philippines’ can be found at 12 locations around Singapore but the one at Lucky Plaza is its very first one. Tuck into Chickenjoys (that’s what they call their chickens!)  that’s oh-so-crispy and juicy or get a load of their Loaded Fries which comes with sriracha or garlic ranch chicken.

Where: 304 Orchard Rd, #B1-19/24 Lucky Plaza, Singapore 238863
Opening hours: Sun – Thu 7am – 10pm, Fri – Sat 7am -11pm

6. The Assembly Ground

The Assembly Ground dishes some mouth-watering bites that are bound to have the brood jumping for joy. Best part? Kids under 10 years dine for free! Young diners can pick between a chicken burger or a chicken ramen, while adults will love mains like Miso Pork ($26++) and Crab Promodoro ($25++). Otherwise, reach for an American Cheeseburger pizza ($24++) to share. Don’t leave without trying their Sticky Ondeh Pudding ($13++) for the perfect sweet finish.

Where: The Assembly Ground, Orchard Cineleisure, 8 Grange Road #01-01, Singapore 239695
Opening hours: Mon – Thu 11.30am – 9pm⁣⁣, Fri 11.30am – 10pm⁣⁣, Sat 11am – 10pm⁣⁣ & Sun 11am – 9pm

7. EAT-PLAY-LAUGH Resto Bar at Orchard Central

Looking to refuel after an action-packed game at X-SCAP8? EAT PLAY LAUGH RestoBar serves up quite a feast for you and your littlies to reboot for your second round at the indoor fun ground. Enjoy a mouth-watering lineup of Italian goodies like all-cheesy pizzas, pasta, crunchy and fresh off-the-heat fish and chips, juicy burgers and the like. We highly recommend the burger with the generous serving of chips and a side salad, and the view from the alfresco dining area is beautiful. Fun for the whole fam!

Where: X-SCAP8, Orchard Central, Level 7, 181 Orchard Road, Singapore 238896
Opening hours: Mon – Sun 11am – 10pm Free entry, with chargeable activities

8. Bedrock Bar & Grill at Pan Pacific Serviced Suites Orchard

The wood-grilled meat and seafood at Bedrock Bar & Grill may be the star of the show, but its sides, particularly the Bedrock Mac N’ Cheese ($25++), are scene-stealers in their own right. This rich and creamy dish is a sure-winner for the kids, mine couldn’t get enough of it, while parents can treat themselves to indulgent steaks – there’s Australian Wagyu, Japanese Aged Full-Blood Wagyu, Tomahawk, and more. Perfect for sharing with the family. They’ve got lunch sets starting from $32++ that comes with dessert! Yum!

Where: 96 Somerset Rd, #01-05 Pan Pacific Serviced Suites Orchard, Singapore, Singapore 238163
Opening hours: Sun – Thu 12pm -3pm & 6pm -10.30pm, Fri – Sat 12pm -3pm & 6pm -11pm

9. Pizza Express at Scotts Square

It’s no secret the HoneyKids team are big fans of this Brit-imported pizza joint, and we’ve already got our little ones hooked too! Pizza Express has a kids’ pack and a dedicated menu for younger diners (these guys totally get that pasta covered in sauce is the devil incarnate to fussy kids). Imaginative pizza offerings including chilli crab, laksa and carbonara (for those who just can’t decide between pizza and pasta)! Pizza Express tis one place that always proves a surefire hit for the whole family when it comes to dining in the Orchard area. The heavenly dough balls with garlic butter seal the deal for us!

Where: Scotts Square, #B1 08/09, 6 Scotts Road, Singapore 228209
Opening hours: Mon – Thu 11.30am – 9pm, Fri 11.30am -10pm, Sat – Sun 10.30am – 10.30pm

10. Marche Movenpick at 313@Somerset

Switzerland comes to Singapore at family-friendly restaurant Marche Movenpick where you’ll find top-notch European food set in a Swiss Alpine village! Try the delicious rostis with a side-order of mushroom ragout, or go simple but scrumptious with a wood-fired pizza or grilled steak. Pack the kids off to the small play area while you dine in peace, and then bring them back for their own menu deals. They’ll feel all grown up choosing for themselves from the self-service bars. It’s also the place to head for really good freshly baked bread.

Where: 313 Orchard Rd, Level 1, Discovery Walk, 313@Somerset, Singapore 238895
Opening hours: Mon – Thu 11.30am -9.30pm, Fri 11am -10.30pm, Sat 10am -10.30pm, & Sun 10am – 9.30pm

11. Tsui Wah at The Heeren

Whether you are a looking for a snack for tea break or a hearty meal, you’ll find something at this Hong Kong style cafe, Tsui Wah. Find casual Hong Kong food like Crispy Bun with Condensed Milk ($5++), Baked Spaghetti ($16.80++), and Pork Chop Buns ($10++), all best paired with a cup of Milk Tea (from $4.60++). One of our all-time favourites is the BBQ Pork and Scrambled Egg Rice ($17.80++), just can’t enough of that super tender and tasty BBQ Pork that’s perfect with runny eggs over rice!

Where: 260 Orchard Rd, #02-02 COURTS NOJIMA The Heeren, Singapore 238855
Opening hours: Daily 11am – 10pm

12. Eat Alley at Orchard Gateway

This underrated foodcourt with Malaysian food brings some of the best KL hawker favourites to the heart of Orchard Road. EatAlley, from the same company that brought us PappaRich, has everything from charcoal-fried Moonlight Hor Fun ($9.80), Beef Noodles ($9.80), and even Bak Kut Teh ($10.80).  Pork Noodles ($10.80) are recommended too! Because they are in Orchard Road, don’t expect hawker prices but they still are one of the cheaper (and delicious) food options in town.

Where: 277 Orchard Rd, Orchard Gateway, B2-12, Singapore 238858
Opening hours: Daily 10.30am – 9pm

13. Taste Orchard

Formerly OG, the entire building has been transformed into Taste Orchard, a mall with tons of food and some retail options. Here you’ll find Korea’s most popular fried chicken chain, BHC Chicken (stands for Better, Happier, Choice) and Japan’s specialty sweet, Warabimochi Kamakura Singapore. There’s Killiney Kopitiam for your local breakfast fix and Tea Chimes for Middle Eastern and Bombay fusion food. And if your kid loves sushi, there’s the conveyor belt sushi spot, Sushiro on the second floor. There’s something for the whole family here.

Where: 160 Orchard Rd, Singapore 238842
Opening hours: Daily 8.30am – 10.30pm

14. Clayful Art Cafe at Orchard Central

Don’t just eat, make some pottery too! And Clayful Art Cafe lets you do just that. Learn to make pottery or choose one of the ready-made items (from $8) to paint on. It’ll be a great family bonding activity to do while feasting on a Grilled Atlantic Salmon Aglio Olio ($22++) or a Steam Summer Mushroom Steak ($23++) for lunch. For drinks, reach for a Ginseng Cappuccino ($8++) or a Ginseng Smoothie ($13++) for the extra kick!

Where: 181 Orchard Rd, #03-23 Orchard Central Singapore 238896
Opening hours: Sun – Thurs 11am – 10pm, Fri – Sat 11am to 11pm

15. Crystal Cafe at Orchard Grand Court

There’s nothing like a warm, nourishing bowl of porridge to soothe the tired body and soul. If that’s what you crave after a long day out, head to Crystal Cafe for their Taiwan Porridge Buffet (from $22.80++ per adult, $16.80++ per child). Enjoy warm porridge with traditional dishes like braised meats, stir-fried vegetables, alongside classic porridge condiments like salted egg, pickles, peanuts, and more. For all these and a dessert and drink section at the buffet, it’s one of the more affordable buffet you’ll find in Singapore.

Where: 131 Killiney Rd, Orchard Grand Court Serviced Apartment, Singapore 239571
Opening hours: Mon – Thu 7am-10.30am, 12pm-2.30pm, & 5.30 – 9pm; Fri – Sun 7am-10.30am, 12pm -1.30pm, & 5.30 – 9pm

16. Tiong Bahru Bakery at TANGS Orchard

Tiong Bahru Bakery is a fave with good reason, and we can’t get enough of it! This homegrown brand churns out a line-up of nom-worthy French-inspired bakes like croissants, pain au chocolat, brioche, and so much more. Grab yourself a cosy cuppa and spoil yourself (and the fam) silly with all that finger-licking goodness before hitting the Orchard high streets! Psst, don’t miss out on TBB’s merch, including a host of French perishables like jams, pate, confit etc.

Where: 310 Orchard Road, #01-16B TANGS Orchard, Singapore 238864
Opening hours: Mon – Fri 7.30am – 8.30pm, Sat – Sun 8am – 8.30am

17. Nassim Hill Bakery Bistro Bar

We love Nassim Hill Bakery Bistro Bar as its carefully curated menu has something special for everyone. Tuck into simple and comforting dishes as the bistro bar transforms itself from a friendly brunch cafe by day to a warm dining place by night. From flipping over a Buttermilk Pancake Stack for brunch to getting that big bite off of a juicy Nassim Hill Classic Burger by night, the menu adapts perfectly to the time of day. We think the fam will be spoilt for choice no matter what time of day you plan to hit up the resto.

Where: #01-03, Tanglin Post Office, 56 Tanglin Road, Singapore 247964
Opening hours: Tues – Sun 8am -10pm (Closed Mon)

And there you have it! A delicious list of 17 family-friendly restaurants and cafes to have on your radar with the brood. Now that you have the food department sorted, how about some fun things to do at Orchard road? Check out our ultimate guide for this shopping hood!

item.content:encoded:
Our favourite Mother’s Day gift ideas in Singapore: From spa treatments to jewellery and more

Have you started planning for Mother’s Day? The special day falls on 11 May 2025 in Singapore, and if you need gifting ideas, we’re sharing our favourite Mother’s Day gift ideas. Besides their birthdays, it’s the only day when mums get treated like queens with gifts and crafts aplenty. Whether it’s for a mum-to-be, a new mum or a seasoned mum, we’ve put together some gift ideas that’ll make any mum, including us, happy. Take note, husbands! And if you’re taking mum out, here are more ways to pamper mum.

The Ultimate Mother’s Day Giveaway

Why not try your hand at winning something special for mum? We’re talking Mother’s Day gifts like a luxury hotel stay, dining experiences, fashion, and so much more in our Ultimate Mother’s Day Giveaway! Think gorgeous gift boxes, a mum-and-child perfume experience, champagne and caviar, a home security camera package, luxe loungewear, and other goodies from our fave brands. Enter the giveaway before Thursday 8 May 2025, 11:59pm to get in the draw!

What you need to know about our giveaway: Competition closes on 8 May 2025, 11:59pm, and winners will be notified by email. Winners need to be in Singapore to claim their prizes. All T&Cs will be at the discretion of vendors. This giveaway is non-refundable or exchangeable for cash. Check out our full competition terms and conditions for more details!

All the best Mother’s Day gifts in Singapore!

1. Wake up and smell the flowers

As cliché as it may look, a bouquet of lovely flowers never fails to put a smile on our faces. Go with carnations, the symbol of familial love, or pink roses for appreciation and gratitude. Better yet, order mum’s favourites flowers from the best florists in Singapore. Psst, lots of our top picks do same-day or next-day delivery.

2. A personalised storybook

How about surprising mums with a personalised storybook this Mother’s Day to make storytime even more special? We say this pressie is the perfect way for littlies to say thank you. Especially for all those wonderful storytime sessions come bedtime, night after night. This heartwarming book from Wonderbly features rhyme and colourful illustrations and can feature a mummy alongside up to three kiddos. We’ve also found lovely personalised book options from Your Surprise!

3. Gift some pampering goodness

We will never say no to pampering gifts, especially if they involve luxurious ingredients like ginseng. Sulwhasoo’s facial programs not only feature their nourishing range of skincare products but they also include massages with jade massagers.  For time-strapped mums, Gracious Nook‘s facial + hair reflexology combos are the best 2-in-1 treatments. Pamper mum with touch of wisteria from Japan at Ikeda Spa – Mother’s Day packages include a scrub or soak with the Wisteria zen candle massage. But if all mum wants is to have some TLC at home, choose from our list of the best mobile spa services to book for Mother’s Day!

4. Gift mum a gift set (that we guarantee she’ll love!)

This vibrant gift set from Uncommon Goods to amp up that rest and recuperation score all mums need? It comes packed with a sari robe, hand-sewn blooming teas and more. We can’t say enough about Giftr, the online marketplace for gifts, and their extensive range of gift sets. Find anything from preserved flowers and food stuff, to personalised gifts and more. You can also shop by budget over here. If decision fatigue is wearing you down, send mum a surprise with Okimochi Box. It’s basically a blind box (and a test of how well you know mum) that’s meticulously curated for mum, so, you won’t know what’s inside the Mother’s Day gift until you open it!

5. Beautiful new PJs or loungewear (and extra sleep!)

Sometimes the gift of good rest is all we need, especially for us mums. And the road to good rest couldn’t start better than with a pair of comfy PJs or loungewear! Lucky for us, Singapore is far from short of local brands offering luxurious loungewear. We’ve waxed lyrical about Rawbought‘s buttery-soft PJ sets, but we also love the ones from mumpreneur-owned RAPH & REMY and local brand SOJAO.

6. Unique bouquets

They say that flowers are the language of love but these days we see love being expressed in many other ways, such as a croissant bouquet! Coming from PAUL Singapore, the delicious bouquet comes with four mini croissants and two regular sized ones, all wrapped and ready to go. For something handmade that lasts forever, LEGO’s Flower Bouquet is the perfect gift! Especially when it’s built with your heart and soul. For the practical mums, this Cash Bouquet will surely put a smile on their face!

7. A portable massager

‘Mum back’ is absolutely a real thing – ask any mum and they’ll tell you the various aches and pains they feel in that area! So for the all the times she can’t set aside a couple hours for a professional massage, a portable massager would step in as her on-demand device for quick relief. Splurge on a HYDRAGUN HeatPulse Back & Core Massager, that comes with three massage settings and heating function. Or relief soreness with Decathlon’s EMS + TENS pro-waist massager.  Osim’s neck massager is the perfect gift for Miffy fans (and stiff necks), and if that viral Tiktok eye massager has caught your eye, know that it has four modes for deep relaxation.

8. Wellness & beauty gadgets

While we love our facial treatments, there’s nothing quite like giving the gift of a beauty device for spa-quality facials at home – especially if mum is a huge beauty junkie! Skin Inc’s Deepcare O2 Hydro-Facial Pore Refiner Device is great for deep cleansing and oxygenating the skin, and Foreo will elevate mum’s cleansing regime with their top-of-the-line massagers. Medicube’s 6-in-1 AGE R – Booster Pro will help with pore care, lifting, contouring, and more. For panda eyes, Est.Lab’s Intelligent Eye Revitaliser will reduce puffiness and brighten up dark circles.

9. Perfume making workshop

How about making something for mum that she’ll love and wear? Like her very own signature scent? Bespoke perfume atelier, SIFR Aromatics, offers a personal perfume consultation where their in-house perfumer will craft a blend based on your preferences, habits, and memories. Or you can let mum DIY at scent workshops run by brands like Maison 21G and Le Labo. If you’re planning to head to Sentosa for the day, why not let mum sneak away to Scentopia to make her fragrance?

10. Sustainable gifts

If sustainability is something close to your mum’s heart, we suggest taking a green approach with your Mother’s Day gifts this year-round. Chic mamas will love this local sustainable fashion brand, .bungkus which makes their stylish bags from single-use plastics. Customise a Photo Frame Speaker with Decibelist, known for their sustainably 3D printed speakers or shop bags made from recycled plastic bottles from Bellroy. Take your pick from collectives like The Social Space or  GiftGood, where they carry products from sustainable and socially-impactful brands. If you are the type wake up late, GiftGood offers same-day delivery around Singapore!

11. Spoil mum with beautiful jewellery

Does mum love a bit of sparkle? Take gift-giving to the next level with a gorgeous bangle, bracelet, necklace or a stunning new pair of earrings to celebrate Mother’s Day this year. We love these zirconia and conflict-free blings from By Invite Only; they even have a range with natural stones like amethyst, lapis lazuli, and more, for healing, luck, or balance. You can personalise trinkets and mix and match your very own sets at A Kind of OOOF. On top of the handcrafted 925 silver pieces, they also carry a range of gold jewellery.

12. Send mum on a trip

Yes, this will require a little bit of planning but trust us, there’s nothing like sending mum to her favourite destination for Mother’s Day. Make it a restorative trip with flights to trending wellness destinations like Phuket, Maldives, or even Manila. Or if it’s nature she loves, Lavender season starts from late June in Sapporo, Japan. Psst…we’re giving away a two-night stay in a five-star luxury resort in Lombok in our Ultimate Mother’s Day Giveaway.

13. A staycation

Some of us mums dream of nothing more than a short sabbatical without having to worry about the littlies in tow. Need we mention the long list of responsibilities that follow? Even if it’s just for a few hours! Here’s a nudge towards dads and kiddos, a day staycation (or overnighter) is a great gift to give hard-working mummies a break for Mother’s Day. All mums need is a few hours to themselves and a change of scene for a relaxing celebration.

14. Treat Mum to afternoon tea

We’d love to be spoilt with gourmet delights at one of these splendid afternoon teas. From tea for two to kid-friendly options, there’s something for every mum on this list! Even better if you can combine a special day out with an equally special gift.

15. Indulge at a Mother’s Day brunch

If an afternoon tea doesn’t float your boat, then opt to go all out with one of these fab Mother’s Day brunches in Singapore, or a set menu option. The restaurants are pulling out all the stops so get booking early; we reckon these could be in demand!

16. Capture mum’s beautiful side

Send mum for a full makeover and have her beautiful smiles captured with professional photographers. Involve the whole family with a day of taking family portraits, dress to a theme and create memories for Mother’s Day. If mum is camera-shy, you can still get her a makeover and have the photo shoot in a private room at Photopia – she’ll hold the controls to the camera. It’s like an elevated photo booth experience!

17. Mum’s favourite drinks

Mums fuel themselves through the day with their favourite drinks, so, why not give them what they need for Mother’s Day? Help mum start the day right with a bespoke hamper from Bacha Coffee or set up the space up with TWG French Early Grey candle, alongside a spot of tea for her mid-day break. If she needs her mummy juice, head over to Vivino shop, where they’ll be more than happy to recommend wines. Or order a fun gift box from Thirsty.com.

18. Treat mum to a new watch or strap

Timepieces makes for an excellent Mother’s Day gift, so how about a new watch for the leading ladies in your life? Cocomi has designer options from August Berg, BERING, Coach, Boss plus super-pretty Olivia Burton pieces. Make sure you check out their gift sets that can include elegant jewellery options. If vintage is more mum’s jam, we love the beautiful exclusive styles from Nakedglory Vintage, who are online and also often host pop-ups at fairs all around Singapore. Turn up her existing watches with bespoke watch straps from RSM Watch Strap. They come in all sorts of material, colours, and sizes, mum can switch up her straps to match her outfit anytime.

19. Make a difference and make someone else’s Mother’s Day

If you’re struggling with gifts this year, remember it’s the thought that counts. How about donating to a charity close to Mum’s heart? There are loads of charities out there that would value any support. Shop SCWO’s mid year bazaar where all proceeds go to supporting women and girls. With deals starting from just $1, you can take mum on a shopping spree, and for good! You can also make a donation to Aidha, a charity group that offers free language lessons to migrant domestic workers and lower income women in Singapore.

20. And don’t forget we love homemade gifts too!

Nothing melts our hearts like Mother’s Day gifts that are DIY crafts and cards from the littlies, so dads, take note!  And, for further inspo on all things related to Mother’s Day gifts, check out what us HoneyKids mums want this Mother’s Day. Although truth be told, the best part about Mother’s Day is breakfast in bed, and getting to spend time together as a family (after a lie-in, of course…!)

And psst – if all else fails, just tell mum how much she means to you – just like us in our vid below!

Top image: Ekaterina Shevchenko

item.content:encoded:
SIFA 2025: We find out what’s in store (and FREE) for kiddos at Singapore’s most exciting performing arts festival

Believe it or not, the biggest performing arts fans in the HoneyKids team aren’t the writers; it’s our kids. Which is why we’re excited to hear that Little SIFA, the family-friendly programme pillar of Singapore International Festival of Arts (SIFA), is returning for a second edition this year.

What’s more, we’re told that Little SIFA is expanding its scope to cover more art forms beyond last year’s theatre and interactive installation. And better still – this year’s Little SIFA programmes are all FOC!

What’s happening at Little SIFA 2025

1. The House Between the Winds by Yang Jie

The little ones will be thrilled to see a magnificent sailboat travel across the festival ground. But that’s not all, kids are invited to be part of the sailboat’s ‘journey’ as it travels through Singapore’s history. Through this moving art installation, you and the kids get to experience how Singapore evolved from a trading post into a safe harbour and home for many of us.

When: Installation open for visiting daily from 19 May – 1 June, 10am -9pm; performance on 23-25 May and 30 May – 1 June 2025, 5-9pm

2. The Purple Symphony

Let the kids dance or sing along to The Purple Symphony’s rendition of familiar tunes at SIFA. Unlike most orchestras, this is one that’s comprised of talented musicians of all abilities, using a mixture of Asian and Western instruments to put on a twist on all-time favourite scores.

When: 23-25 May 2025, 7-7.30pm

3. Animal Farm (30-minute variation) by The Finger Players

Animal Farm may be quite heavy for the kids, but Little SIFA has a shorter variation of the full puppet show adaptation of the George Orwell classic. Think of this as a kid-friendly introduction to the story, with the chance for the littles to get up close and personal with the life-sized puppets of each character, which we heard were specially commissioned by The Fingers Player puppetry theatre company.

When: 30 May – 1 June 2025, 7-7.30pm

All of Little SIFA’s programmes will be held at Empress Lawn, near the Victoria Concert Hall and Asian Civilisations Museum.

Wait, there’s more to SIFA than Little SIFA…

We read that the first ever SIFA Pavilion is a great spot for you to visit with the kiddos too. Stationed in Bedok Town Square, the location will be transformed into an arts space for the duration of the festival to feature visual pieces and performances. Here are some of our top picks.

4. Speculative F(r)ictions by Brian Gothong Tan

Ever wonder about Bedok’s history? This multimedia experience uses CGI effects and glitch art to tell a reimagined story of the town’s maritime past. Really cool, especially for older kids!

When: Every Friday to Sunday from 16 May – 1 June 2025

5. A Future Untold

Kids love art; and they love it more when they can participate in it. A Future Untold is an art workshop that’s opened to the public, using marine debris to create unique ‘paintings’. We like that it encourages kids’ imaginations to run wild, while teaching them the importance of sustainability at the same time.

When: 23-25 May 2025, 4-9pm

6. Sing Song Social Club

A choir performance that allows its audience to join in? Count us (and the kids) in! Nothing makes the little ones happier than being able to sing their favourite tunes along with a big group. Sing Song Social Club provides everyone – young and young and heart – a safe space for their voices to be heard, we stan!

When: 1 June 2025, 8.15pm

From whimsical art installations to sing-along performances, there’s something for every family at SIFA 2025. So mark your calendars for these highlights, or check out the SIFA official website for other programmes and the full schedule.

This post is in partnership with Singapore International Festival of Arts.

item.content:encoded:
Top things to do for Mother’s Day 2025 in Singapore: Brunch, staycations, spas & more

Of course, there are plenty of days to show love and appreciation all year round but when Mother’s Day day arrives, why not make it more memorable? Be sure to mark your calendars because Mother’s Day falls on Sunday, 11 May 2025. Take a break from all the chores and indulge mum (or yourself) at the some of the best places to dine on Mother’s Day. Better yet, celebrate the day with fun things to do from our Mother’s Day special guide. As mothers ourselves, we round up the top things to do for Mother’s Day 2025 in Singapore – this guide is perfect for forwarding, as a “subtle hint,” to your other half and kiddos.

Go-to gifting

1. Shop for an amazing gift with our Mother’s Day Gift Guide

Take mum out shopping or bookmark this page and stay tuned for updates on Mother’s Day gift ideas!

When food is mum’s love language

2. Afternoon tea party

Round up your best mum friends and spend the afternoon like a “tai tai” sipping tea (and spilling “tea”), alongside delightful pastries and tasty snacks at the best spots for afternoon tea in Singapore. Make a reservation at the prettiest afternoon tea in Singapore or enjoy a tête-à-tête at one of the bougie luxury brand cafes, and who knows, you might just leave with one of their coveted items.

3. Bottomless brunch

Sleep is one of the greatest luxuries for mums (those with school going children, you know what I am talking about). Make Mother’s Day special by letting mum sleep in, and when she wakes up, whisk her off to one these amazing brunches in town. Make it a bubbly one!

4. Idyllic picnic in nature

Fido is invited for this one! Head to East Coast Park for a beachfront picnic with Italian street fare or spread the mat for a picnic on the wide open fields of Botanic Gardens. Best part, you don’t have to prepare the food, or anything else, simply order in advance and collect. An easy and charming way to celebrate Mother’s Day!

5. Cook for mum

Surprise mum with breakfast in bed. You don’t have to cook up a storm; breakfast staples like ham and eggs, french toast, and pancakes will do the trick. Dads, why not trying your hand at these easy bakes together with kids? It’s a great bonding activity and you’ll score brownie points for this one!

6. Mother’s Day dinner

Go all out and splurge on those calories you’ve been saving for Mother’s Day. Many restaurants offer dinner sets and extensive buffets for this special day. Check out our full list of Mother’s Day dining in Singapore.

Pamper mum and relieve tension

7. Spa and massage

One the best ways to recharge and refresh a tired parent is with a pampering sesh at the spa. Luxurious spa treatments that come with a scrub, massage, and a wrap is guaranteed to melt all the stresses away. Besides relaxing those tense muscles, mum will leave with radiant, glowing skin, and a big smile on her face. If mum is always on her feet, you might want check out these foot reflexology spots in Singapore. Trust us, this is one of the best things to do for mum on Mother’s Day.

8. Head spa and massage

It’s all on the mind, they say! If it’s true for worries, over planning, and overthinking, it must hold true for relaxation too. Don’t underestimate this seemingly simple massage, with the right techniques and pressure they’ll take the weight off your mind and neck. Do it with the sound of nature, try a dry head massage for better sleep, or do it with a Tibetan sound bath for deeper relaxation. Bonus! You’ll have a clean scalp and shiny hair for Mother’s Day.

9. Soak in an onsen

Sitting in a tub of hot water may not seem much of a celebration for Mother’s Day. But think of all the benefits, like relieving fatigue and improving blood circulation and metabolism, you’ll get just by soaking in an onsen. It’s also believed to smoothen out wrinkles! Best part, you don’t have to fly to Japan for that. These mineral-rich waters are available in Singapore, and you can even throw in a massage session to make it extra special for mum!

10. Float in stillness

If all you desire is some peace and quiet for Mother’s Day, consider floating in these flotation pods. Filled with tons of epsom salts, you’ll naturally float when you lean back and relax. Once the pod closes (you can open it anytime), you’ll enjoy complete silence and may even feel weightless – that’s when you realise all the tension in the body is gone. This meditative session is not recommended for people with claustrophobia.

Get active with mum

11. Walk, scoot or cycle in nature

Did you know that the park connectors connect almost the whole of Singapore? Gear up with your bikes and skates and explore the park connector loops or take a nice stroll in one of the many nature parks in Singapore. Add a dash of history when you trek at Fort Canning or check out the gentler pram-friendly walks. This is one wholesome thing to do for Mother’s Day,

12. Family yoga

Yoga is not just for adults! It can be for kids too. Play, movement, and parent-child bonding come together in family yoga classes. Make Mother’s Day ultra special when you connect deeply  with one another through mindful movement and engaging activities.

13. Climb rocks and boulders

Rock climbing is great for kids and it’s fun for adventurous adults. It requires strategic planning and coordination, and builds strength and flexibility. Scale to new heights as a family and encourage one another as you go along. It’ll be an exciting Mother’s Day to remember.

14. Dragon-boating

This is one activity that you’ll talk about for years to come. Spend an oar-some time with mum dragon-boating along the Kallang Basin this Mother’s Day. Learn to paddle at Sports Hub’s Dragon Boat orientation ($30 for 2 pax) and bond through this water adventure. No experience needed, just a day of fun and teamwork under the guidance of the trainers.

Make mum feel her most beautiful

15. Facials and beauty treatments

Let’s face it! We sometimes skip over our beauty regime to meet the mad morning rush. And after a long day of work, all we want to do, is sleep. If this sounds like you (or your mum), it’s time to get some TLC with facials in Singapore. It’s a quick solution to brighten dull skin and work on those annoying spots. For more targeted issues or quicker solutions, make an appointment at aesthetic clinics to HIFU your way to V-shape face or pico laser to even out your complexion. Who doesn’t want to look their best on Mother’s Day?

16. Home pampering treatments

Beauty in the comfort of home? These mobile beauty services in Singapore offer manicures, eyelash extensions, massages, and more. Some are even marked “mum safe,” using gentle products suitable for breastfeeding mothers. We won’t say no to convenient beauty!

17. Take a family portrait

When was the last time you took a family portrait? We mean, one that you actually looked good in. It’s true that our smartphones take photos of amazing quality but nothing beats a professional touch. Especially when they come with a makeover and expert guidance. Capture the best side of the family on Mother’s Day with these photographers in Singapore.

Spend quality time together

18. Book a staycation

With all the swanky new hotels that’s popping up in Singapore, there’s no shortage of options. Make it a Mother’s Day weekend with family-friendly staycations that’ll keep everyone in the family happy. Or make it really memorable, spend a night underwater, in the rainforest, or even on a bus!

19. Go island hopping

Singapore is an island, with 63 other islands! Bet you didn’t know! Although not all of them are open for visits, some are reserved for military use, we can island hop to popular ones like Sentosa, Lazarus, Kusu, Pulau Ubin and more. Charter a boat or hop on a ferry to explore the Southern Islands of Singapore. No passports required!

20. Beach day out

Singapore is no Bali when it comes to beaches but we do have the white sands on Sentosa to kick back and soak up the sun. Make your way to one of the family-friendly beach clubs and leave the kiddos (and Fido) to the sand and sea, while you unwind with a Mojito or Magarita in hand.

21. Movie marathon night

Load up the ice cream and popcorn because we’re snuggling in bed, or our blanket forts, for a movie marathon night at home – the family version of Netflix and chill. Nothing beats spending quality time with your favourite people, binging on your favourite movies, in your favourite place.

Don’t forget the Mother’s Day gifts and flowers. If all else fails, surprise her by checking-out everything in her shopping cart!

Happy Mother’s Day!

item.content:encoded:
Sweet Deals: All the best deals for families in Singapore this June 2025

There’s a ton of fantastic family deals in Singapore, and we’ve done the hard work for you! We’ve been searching the net and hitting the shops to find the absolute best deals, promotions, credits, rewards, and offers for families in Singapore! Travelling on holiday? We’ve got the lowdown on cheap airfares, including Singapore airlines promo codes. Book ahead and save more, and check out loads of shopping promos and discounts to satisfy your retail cravings without breaking the bank. Happy shopping!

Family deals on attractions in Singapore

1. Complimentary kids’ ticket at Adventure Cove

Ready for some splashin’ good fun at Adventure Cove? The little one gets to tag along for free with two adult tickets purchased, plus $10 worth of retail and dining vouchers. That’ll be good to recharge and refuel the fam after a day of water slides, snorkeling with colourful fish, admiring the beautiful corals, and much more! Make sure to purchase your tickets for entry by 30 June 2025 to enjoy the complimentary kids ticket for children aged four to 12.

2. Celebrate SG60 with discounts at various attractions

Looking for something to do during the weekend is now much easier on the wallet with discounts for over 20 different attractions! What better way to celebrate SG60 with amazing deals like kids entering for free, passes that come with discounts on unlimited entries, bundle deals, and much more. Here are some of the family-friendly attractions that will be on discount:

  • Sentosa 4D AdventureLand ($60 for two person 4-in-1 combo)
  • Singapore Flyer ($60 for two admission tickets)
  • Tayo Station (20% off Family Fun Bundle)
  • Madame Tussauds Singapore ($60 for two tickets)
  • Skyline Luge Singapore (27% off SG60 Family Fun Bundle)
  • Snow City ($60 family bundle)

For more info on the deals, check the full list here!

3. 50% off tickets to Mandai Wildlife Parks for POSB Everyday Card or PAssion POSB Debit Card holders

Looking to bring the kids to Bird Paradise, Night Safari, River Wonders, or the Singapore Zoo? POSB and Mandai Wildlife Reserve have come together to create a deal for POSB Everyday Card or PAssion POSB Debit Card holders to enjoy 50% off both adult and child admission tickets! Use promo code “POSB50” for POSB Everyday Card and promo code “PADEBIT50” for PAssion POSB Debit Card when purchasing tickets from now till 31 December 2025.

4. School’s out, fun’s in! $7 movies on the weekdays at Golden Village

For all you students out there, Golden Village has some killer discounts on 2D and 3D movie tickets! It’s a steal with tickets at $7 from Monday to Friday before 6pm – just flash your student card when you buy your ticket and you’re good to go! Oh, and don’t forget to skim through the terms and conditions before you dive into your movie marathon. Get that popcorn popping and enjoy the big screen extravaganza – check out some of the brand new blockbusters to look forward to this year!

Valid till 30 December 2025 for full time primary, secondary, polytechnic & tertiary students in Singapore

5. Save with over 100 deals exclusively for Sentosa Islander Members

It pays to sign up for free membership to the Sentosa Islander! There are more than 100 deals, promos and discounts exclusively for Sentosa Islander members, on everything from dining to attractions to free parking. Keep checking the list to see what’s in store for you as a member each month!

6. Dine with a fireworks show at almost 50% off

Want to watch some fireworks from the comfort of an air-conditioned location while nomming on yummy food? The Show & Dine bundle not only gives you a comfortable seat, it also gives you a higher vantage point to really soak in the show! You’ll also get a choice of beef or chicken burger with fries, a side serving of calamari and popcorn, plus a drink. While the HoneyKids team hasn’t got to try the deal, we did enjoy our time when we checked the fireworks show for ourselves. We loved the fireworks show which was four times longer than previous shows – that’s 20 minutes of beautiful displays! Make a trip with the fam to Sentosa’s Siloso Beach for one of the two shows at 7.40pm or 8.40pm. Tickets are already on sale on their website, make sure you book them early so you don’t miss out on the Wings of Time Fireworks Symphony!

7. Sentosa Fun Discovery Pass

Calling all you adventure lovers and thrill seekers! Listen up because the Fun Discovery Pass is your golden ticket to major savings while you enjoy thrilling adventures at Sentosa. This pass stays valid for a solid 180 days from the day you snag it, meaning you can use it whenever you’re in the mood during this time. Plus, with the Fun Discovery Pass Itinerary Planner, you can effortlessly figure out how many tokens you and your gang will need for your favourite activities. Get ready for fun right at your fingertips!

8. NEW! Friends of Mandai pass with access to all 5 wildlife parks from $275

Got a bunch of mini wildlife enthusiasts in your crew? We’ve got the inside scoop on memberships you’ll want to check out! Meet the Friends of Wildlife and Friends of Wildlife Plus – two awesome membership tiers that’ll hook you up with loads of discounts and cool perks. Get ready for a year filled with adventure! You’ll score yearly access to Bird Paradise, Night Safari, River Wonders, Singapore Zoo, and the new Rainforest Wild park, plus sweet birthday month gifts, exclusive sneak peeks at events, a Parking Pass for Multi-Storey Carparks, and a bunch more. It’s a wild treat just waiting for you and your gang!

9. National Gallery Singapore – GALLERYKIDS! Membership

We all love National Gallery Singapore for its ever-changing art showcase and interactive activities for the kiddos. If you are a frequent visitor and would like to keep a tab on all happenings at the gallery, we say the GALLERYKIDS! membership is well worth subscribing for! What are the benefits? Well, GalleryKids! members get access to menus with exclusive dishes at selected dining venues, a 10% discount for Gallery Children’s publications, and monthly newsletters featuring new GalleryKids! Special programmes and so much more. Psst, you also get first dibs for events and festivals specially created for kids.

10. Friends of Gardens Membership

Ever wanted to dive into a world of everlasting springtime with your tribe? Well, check out the Friends of the Gardens (Flower Dome Only) membership! With this pass, you’ll be cruising into the Flower Dome all year round to catch awesome floral shows like Poinsettias, Dahlias, Sakura, Tulips, and lots more. And guess what? As a member, you’ll snag cool perks like free two-hour parking, early access to exclusive stuff, and invites to our super special events and ever-changing floral displays! It’s like walking into an eternal spring wonderland! Click here for more information about the membership.

Pssst… it’s also a great idea to keep an eye on the Calendar of Events for the lowdown on fun fam-friendly activities and free workshops!

11. ArtScience Museum promotions: kids go free on Fridays!

If you’re planning a trip to the ArtScience Museum, then make sure you check out all of its current promotions and make the best out of them! Plus, stay tuned to everything happening at the Art Science Museum with the ArtScience Friends membership (an extension of the Sands Rewards LifeStyle programme). Enjoy great perks like 30% savings on attraction tickets, shopping, dining, and more at Marina Bay Sands. There are tons of membership benefits too, like unlimited visits, exclusive previews, discounts & rewards, and priority entry. Or, take advantage of Family Fridays – where every adult can bring in four kids under the age of 12 years for free (but note this isn’t valid on public and Singapore school hols).

12. Save on your stay at Legoland Malaysia

If you and fam travel across the border regularly to visit LEGOLAND Malaysia, now’s your chance to enjoy 20% off the LEGOLAND Malaysia Resort Day tickets! For a limited time, anyone including international guests, can enjoy the deal on the Theme Park, Double Park, or Triple Park day tickets.
Where: 7, Persiaran Medini Utara 3, 79100 Iskandar Puteri, Johor, Malaysia

Family staycation deals in Singapore

13. Family Escapade at Capella

If you’re looking for a luxurious family getaway with both fun and savings, look no further than Capella’s Family Escapade package! Here, the whole gang can dive into $150 resort credits, free entry to Universal Studios Singapore, and plenty more perks. Kids dine for free, get cool complimentary children’s amenities like a teepee tent for the entire stay, along with overnight parking per room throughout your visit, and more fantastic benefits!

14. Sneak away to Sentosa: 5% off the room rate with advance bookings at Equarius Hotel and Hotel Ora

If you’ve ever wanted to stay at the uber luxurious Equarius Hotel or the newly opened Hotel Ora on Sentosa, then the best way is to book in advance! With special 45-day advance booking rates, you can include breakfast for two and enjoy a discount. Personally, we’d like to leave the kiddos at home for this one and enjoy a little romantic getaway!

15. Extended stay for less at Four Seasons Hotel Singapore

Looking to make the most of the Hari Raya Haji weekend with an extended stay and quality family time? Look no further than the Stay Longer package offered by Four Seasons Hotel Singapore! Here’s the deal: Book three nights in a row, and they’ll sweeten the deal by tossing in a fourth night for free. It’s the perfect opportunity to enjoy an extra day of relaxation, fun, and bonding with your loved ones. Pack your bags and get ready for an unforgettable extended staycation!

Valid for selected dates from now till 31 December 2025

Family travel deals from Singapore

16. Score some travel deals from this 6.6 sale

Our team loves to travel, so we’re always on the lookout for good travel deals, especially for the school holidays. Trip.com has limited-time offers on flights, hotels, and vouchers that will be flying off the shelves so make sure to check them out before they’re gone! Get ready before you travel with Universal Traveller and their amazing deals on luggage. Try not to get too shocked by their Shocking Sale full of vouchers, flash sales, and prices as low as $36! Motherswork also has 30% off sunscreens, mini luggages, sleep buddies, and mealtime needs – everything you need for smooth travels. Jet set, go!

17. Disney Adventure Cruise Ship bookings are now open

You might have heard that Disney Cruise Line is coming to Singapore in 2025, with a brand new ship called the Disney Adventure! Look forward to stellar service and entertainment, dining experiences along with the signature whimsy and wonder against the backdrop of stories from Disney, Marvel, and Pixar. Along with a whole heap of innovative firsts, we can’t wait to see what’s in store for us with Disney Cruise Line and the specially curated experiences for South East Asia! Check out the cruise dates and book one for the fam.

18. It’s time to book a cruise, with new routes now open

Looking for a taste of the sights and sounds of South East Asia, without the plane travel? Check out the newly released 2025/2026 cruise itineraries from Royal Caribbean. The fan favourite Quantum Class ship, Ovation of the Seas, has a line-up of experiences that make for a memorable holiday for every type of traveller. Visit awe-inspiring destinations like Indonesia, Malaysia, Thailand and more, and get involved in loads of fun on-board activities (there’s even rock climbing and bodyboarding!). Book early for the best prices.

19. Fly Scoot and save, with round-trip flights under $200 to fun destinations!

With flights this cheap, why not explore a place you’ve never been with the fam? Scoot has special offers on round-trip tickets that are perfect for a last minute getaway, or a short flight from home to shop, dine and explore somewhere different to Singapore! ‘You deserve a break, and you don’t need to break the bank to do so!’ Take the first step towards an epic family adventure and book your escape today – all for less than $200! Visit Malaysia, Thailand or Indonesia, for less.

20. Singapore Airlines’ travel platform, Pelago has special offers (up to 20% off!)

Ready to take your holiday to new heights? Singapore Airlines has an ongoing travel sale until 30 June 2025. Picture yourself jetting off to cool spots like Bangkok, Hong Kong, Dubai, and more! Time to get those travel plans rolling for some epic adventures! Better yet, book your holiday activities through Singapore Airline’s Pelago booking platform and you can save up to $150! KrisFlyers will also be happy to know that you can collect 3 KrisFlyer miles for every $1 spent when you book on Pelago – bonus!

21. Club Med’s all-inclusive holiday deals

Are you looking to embark on a fun-filled vacation with the whole family? Well, look no further than Club Med’s all-inclusive holiday deals. The best part? You can discover a deal and resort that perfectly suits your family’s needs. Enjoy offers like ‘Little Kids, Big Savings,’ where your little ones get to stay for free or avail of discounted stays. The options are endless!

Shopping deals in Singapore

22. 6.6 shopping sales

Don’t forget to score some massive deals on sites like Shopee, Zalora, Lazada, and many other brands – the sales have already started! Sites like Shopee have limited time deals so make sure to tune in ASAP and be ready before they go in a flash.

23. The best time to grab a new laptop or PC from Lenovo

Kid at home and wants to get an upgrade for their gaming PC? Or need a new laptop for work? It’s a great time to invest in one with Lenovo’s 6.6 sale! They’ve got discounts on laptops, desktops, gaming PCs, monitors, and more – save up to 45% and upgrade your tech for less.

24. Extra 50% Off Sale at Puma

Not only will you save with Puma, you’re getting an extra 50% off existing promotions! That’s right, from 6 June 2025 to 9 June 2025, stock up on shoes, clothing, and accessories from Puma and get active during the June holidays. Or if you haven’t thought of what to get dad for Father’s Day, here’s your chance to get him a new pair of sneakers.

25. Wide range of 1-for-1 products at Watsons

Stock up on the most-wanted bath, oral, and feminine wash products with Watsons. You’ll get to pick from a wide variety of products that are buy one, get one free – make sure to check out their website for all the items on sale.

26. Motherswork – Final sale with up to 50% off!

Entrepreneur Sharon Wong has been caring for families through her business, Motherswork, for 27 years. To celebrate, she’s having a bumper sale! If you’re looking to save on everything for baby, including prams, toys, carseats and more, then you won’t want to miss the Motherswork Final Sale! Expect deals of up to 50% off big name brands. Now is the time to buy for baby!

27. JD Sports – amazing deals on the coolest sneakers and sportswear

Teens (and parents!) this one’s for you. If you fancy some new Nike kicks, now is the time to head to JD Sports and check out all the amazing discounts on some of the hottest sneakers. There are also t shirts and other sports wear on sale for up to 50% off!

28. Discounts on adorable items at Mothercare

No need for introductions to this ultimate shopping paradise, a true mecca for all things baby and beyond on our little island.  Mothercare has got a sale on a large variety of goods for the little ones, you’ll definitely find something you need for an affordable price! Plus free next delivery on orders over $60. It’s a deal you just can’t resist!

29. Clearance Blast at Toys ‘R’ Us

Don’t miss out on Toys ‘R’ Us’s incredible clearance blast! You’ll find a ton of fun toys for your little ones at unbeatable discounts. Prices start as low as under $5 and go up to under $50. It’s a one-stop page for amazing deals you won’t want to pass up!

More ways to save money in Singapore: Family deals

30. NTUC Membership – save on almost everything!

If you aren’t an NTUC member, then you’re missing out. Save on everything from groceries at Fairprice to discount tickets for theatre shows and attractions. Join in activities like fun runs and family sports days, and be in the know on what’s new in Singapore by keeping an eye on the member discount page!

31. Changi Rewards

If you are as big a fan of Changi Airport as we are, then signing up for Changi Rewards is well worth its weight in gold. Why? Because this membership unlocks GST-free shopping at the airport – yay! You can even earn points as you shop and dine to redeem exclusive e-vouchers, special items, and deals. Want to amp up the perks a notch? Gold and Platinum members can enjoy complimentary lounge access and free parking.

32. Offers and Rewards with yuu

We have, have yuu? If you’ve been hearing this earworm of a jingle on the radio a lot lately, it’s probably a sign to start exploring the realm of rewards clubs! Anyone can sign up to earn loyalty currency or yuu points at over 1000 top-notch brands islandwide. Think spots like Bread Talk, Cold Storage, Foodpanda, and many others – the options are endless! What’s the deal? For every buck spent at select stores, you’ll bag 1 yuu point in your yuu wallet. It’s a win-win situation, turning your usual purchases into something awesome!

Dining deals in Singapore

33. 1-for-1 main course deal at Jack’s Place

Craving a weekday late lunch meal with a bestie that’s easy on the wallet? If you’ve got a Jack’s Place near you, swing by from 2.30pm to 5pm for a 1-for-1 deal on selected main course items and coffees!

34. $0.60 kopi and teh at select kopitiams

$0.60 for kopi and teh? Count me in! In celebration of our nation’s 60th birthday, enjoy a hot cuppa at just $0.60 from now till 31 August 2025 at a wide range of kopitiams across the island. Click here for a full list of participating kopitiams!

35. Save up to 62% with e-coupons at Burger King

From 1-for-1 deals to big savings, these e-coupons from Burger King are a great way to save – whether you’re craving a burger, sides, or dessert! These are valid till 6 July 2025 so make sure to head down to a Burger King near you soon.

36. Kids eat free at IKEA

Kids Eat Free is back again at IKEA from 2 to 27 June 2025! Bring the little ones to IKEA to enjoy some delicious Swedish meatballs or a plate of spaghetti. Don’t forget to check out their Swedish Food Market while you’re there – enjoy discounts on their Chocolate chip custard twist, Ranch chips, and dried durum wheat pasta!

37. 1-for-1 pizzas and pasta at Amano

Treat the kiddos to a treat with an Italian feast at Amano with their 1-for-1 deals on pizzas and pasta! All day on Mondays to Thursdays and 12pm to 2.30pm on Fridays to Sundays, come dine in to enjoy another pizza or pasta that the little ones can enjoy. Or if you’re looking to takeaway some grub to enjoy at home, you can enjoy a 2-for-1 deal on their pizzas and pasta as well!

38. TriplePlus

Score amazing rewards with TriplePlus! Just sign up for TriplePlus and unlock awesome benefits like up to 10% rebates on dining, exclusive 1-for-1 vouchers, and a bunch more. There are three tiers up for grabs, and climbing higher gets you even cooler perks like off-peak vouchers, special birthday treats, and tons of other goodies. Treat yourself and your crew to fantastic dining while bagging fantastic rewards!

After more sweet family deals in Singapore? Check out these staycations happening now!

item.content:encoded:
Help! My Child Was Bullied.. or is the Bully! What can parents do? with Dr. Kimberly Chew

Parenting Playbook is HoneyKids Asia’s new live Q&A series where we tackle some of the biggest challenges of modern day parenting in real time. This new format is a cross between a podcast, webinar and couch session with a parenting expert, where parents get to ask the tough questions and get real time advice. From doctors to therapists, parenting coaches and fellow parents, HoneyKids hosts Syaz and Ange will be diving into the hot seat with our favourite experts to chat all things parenting!

Step 1: Follow us on Instagram @honeykidsasia
Step 2: Send us a question in our monthly Ask Me Anything callout on Instagram stories
Step 3: Look out for our countdown timer and set a notification to remind you of our upcoming Live Q&A
Step 4: Tune in when it’s time and send more questions if you have them!

Here’s a preview of the topics and guests we have in the lineup so far!

Parenting Playbook: HoneyKids Asia’s new Instagram Live Q&A

Upcoming live sessions

Episode 6: “Help! My child was bullied… or is the bully!” What can parents do? with founder of AO Psychology (Singapore), Dr. Kimberly Chew

In today’s digital world, bullying doesn’t just happen behind closed doors, it can even play out online in viral videos and messages, deepening its impact and effects on everyone involved. In the 6th episode of Parenting Playbook, we speak with Dr. Kimberly Chew of AO Psychology (Singapore) to understand the psychological impact of bullying on children – the bullied and the bully. We delve into the nature of today’s bullying, how parents can recognise the early signs of bullying. We cover practical advice on  how to support your child with compassion and guide them towards emotional resilience and safety.

Dr. Kimberly Chew is an SRP Registered Psychologist with the Singapore Register of Psychologists (SRP) and a mother of three, with a unique perspective on parenting and childhood trauma. She graduated with First Class honours in Doctorate in Clinical Psychology, and founded AO Psychology (Singapore), a holistic psychology practice that uniquely integrates mind (psychotherapy and counselling), body (somatic) and emotion (nutrition) interventions. With her vast experience in both private practice and institutional settings, Dr. Chew emphasises collaboration and empowerment, helping clients develop coping strategies and achieve sustainable mental health outcomes.

When: 29 May 2025, 12pm on Instagram Live

Past live sessions

Episode 1: “When should you give your kid a smartphone?” with Lauren Adlam

Watch it on Instagram or listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts!

“Mum, can I have my own phone? All my friends have one.” Ah, the dreaded day is here! We totally understand the FOMO that may arise from tweens and teens seeing their friends own their own smartphones. But all the advice we’ve heard thus far has been: hold off on giving your kids a phone for as long as possible! So how do we navigate this? HoneyKids host Angela Neo chats with Lauren Adlam on navigating this new minefield! Lauren is a mum of four and founder of ZOWN, a kids-only app that’s all about positivity and created to nurture Gen Alpha (between eight and 14 years old) to thrive.

When: 17 October 2024, 12pm on Instagram Live

Episode 2: “Is it ADHD or something else?” with Joline Lim and Kavitha Manokaran

Watch it on Instagram or listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts!

Thanks to social media and scientific advancements, we’re now more aware than ever of conditions such as Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder (ADHD). But how do we know if our child’s inability to focus or hyperactiveness is really ADHD, or a lack of motivation? We chat with Chapter Zero Singapore Co-Director Joline Lim, whose son was recently diagnosed with ADHD, and Kavitha Manokaran, Senior Clinical Psychologist at International Medical Clinic (IMC).

Keen to find out more about ADHD? Read IMC’s handy guide!

Follow these groups for more support:
Respectful Parenting – Neurodivergent Families Singapore Facebook group
Respectful Parenting ND Families Singapore x DAS PSG WhatsApp group
Unlocking ADHD website

When: 20 November 2024, 12pm on Instagram Live

Episode 3: Balancing encouragement and tiger parenting: Role of parents in helping kids excel with Dr. Christina Wong

Watch it on Instagram or listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts!

We all want our kids to excel. But how do we do that without teetering on the side of tiger parenting? We chat with Dr. Christina Wong on how to be encouraging parents while being mindful not to impose high expectations on our kids. Dr. Christina is the founder of 10X Study Academy, a platform that has helped hundreds of students study better and smarter to become happier in school and have an improved overall well-being.

More resources:
Study coach shares 10 fun study techniques that really work

When: 13 December 2024, 1pm on Instagram Live

Episode 4: “How to stop yelling at your kids” with author and parent educator Kelly Tay

Watch it on Instagram or listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts!

Are you guilty of yelling at your kids? The first step could be understanding your own triggers before addressing your child’s behaviour. Join HoneyKids host Syazana Hishamuddin for an enlightening live discussion with Kelly Tay, certified parent educator, founder of Juicy Parenting and author of The World May Say This, But I Believe That! Learn practical, guilt-free strategies to stay calm, communicate effectively, and create a more peaceful home. Kelly will share expert advice, real-life examples, and actionable tips to help you manage frustration and build stronger connections with your children.

Through her courses and online membership, Kelly teaches Asian parents how to lead with calm and confidence, not fear and force — so that children stay close with family because they want to, not because they feel obliged to. With the vast majority of respectful parenting resources coming from the US and UK, Kelly’s distinctly Asian point-of-view makes her a unique voice in the space.

When: 27 March 2025, 12pm on Instagram Live

Episode 5: “Should we be worried about the emojis teens are using?” Unpacking Adolescence and teen online culture with Head of TOUCH Cyber Wellness, Shem Yao

Watch it on Instagram or listen on Spotify and Apple Podcasts!

If the viral Netflix show Adolescence left you with more questions than answers, you’re not alone. From the rise of the Manosphere to the coded language teens use online, today’s digital world is complex—and constantly shifting. So fast that parents are not even aware. In this episode of Parenting Playbook, we speak with Shem Yao, Head of TOUCH Cyber Wellness to unpack today’s digital realities and online subcultures that are shaping our children’s beliefs and behaviours – for better or for worse. He shares how parents of teens can connect meaningfully with their children, spot red flags, guide them to online safety, and think critically in an ever-connected world.

Shem Yao leads TOUCH Cyber Wellness under the TOUCH Community Services, delivering digital and media literacy programmes to schools, communities, and corporations. Since 2008, he has reached over 400,000 participants through 700+ talks and workshops. A certified Triple P trainer, Shem supports parents in understanding their children’s digital lives and has spent over 20 years working with youths in various organisations and churches. He plays a key role in developing community-based digital wellness initiatives and parenting education.

When: 24 April 2025, 12pm on Instagram Live

Keep up with us on Instagram @honeykidsasia for the latest updates on our upcoming Parenting Playbook Live Q&A sessions!

Have a topic you’d like us to cover? Write to us at hello@honeykidsasia.com!
